analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /

analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /

analyzed: brtson 'grus brtan zhing rab tu gnas par med gyur cing //

translated: Divine son, when bodhisattva great beings possess four qualities, they are exalted through their merit.

analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'doms par byed pa dang / sems @163a *//

analyzed: can gang dag byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa de dag byang chub tu sems bskyed du 'jug pa dang / sprul pa lta bur dus gsum yongs su bsngo ba dang / byang chub kyi sems dang ma bral bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skyed pa mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
translated: They are: (1) instructing bodhisattvas in the perfection of wisdom; (2) encouraging sentient beings who have not given rise to the mind of awakening to give rise to the mind of awakening; (3) dedicating the three times as if they were emanations; and (4) giving rise to all roots of virtue without being separated from the mind of awakening.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan pa'o //

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /

analyzed: mkhas pa gang dag shes rab pha rol phyin 'doms shing //

translated: It all becomes the basis for the mind of omniscience.

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na ye shes kyis chags pa med par spyod pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na ye shes kyis chags pa med par spyod pa rnams yin te /
translated: Divine son, when bodhisattva great beings have four qualities, they practice with wisdom free from attachment.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are those four?

original: shes pas byis pa'i bya ba rnams byed cing nga rgyal gyis byas pa rnams mi byed pa dang / chos thams cad rkyen las rag las shing byin gyis rlob pa med la gang zag dang bral bar shes pa dang / stong pa nyid spyod yul du gyur cing sems can thams cad mi gtong ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: shes pas byis pa'i bya ba rnams byed cing nga rgyal gyis byas pa rnams mi byed pa dang / chos thams cad rkyen las rag las shing byin gyis rlob pa med la gang zag dang bral bar shes pa dang / stong pa nyid spyod yul du gyur cing sems can thams cad mi gtong ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: They are: (1) to engage in childish activities with knowledge and not to engage in them with pride, (2) to know that all phenomena depend on conditions, are not blessed, and are devoid of persons, (3) to have the intention of not abandoning any sentient beings while having emptiness as one’s domain, and (4) to be skilled in the means of not falling into the uncompounded while having the wisdom of the uncompounded.

original: chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing skye mched drug yongs su shes pa srung ba ste /
analyzed: chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing skye mched drug yongs su shes pa srung ba ste /

analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /

analyzed: brten la mkhas pa @163b yin zhing de dag lta med la //
translated: They are skilled in dependence and do not have views.

original: stong nyid spyod yul de dag sems can mi gtong zhing //

analyzed: shes pas pha rol phyin cing chags med spyod pa yin //

analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na shes rab kyi mun pa dang bral ba rnams yin te /
translated: “Divine son, when bodhisattva great beings have four qualities, they are free from the darkness of ignorance.

original: bzhi gang zhe na; thos pas ngoms pa med cing tshul bzhin la rab tu sbyor ba dang / zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos ston pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa shes par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad la sgyu ma lta bur so sor rtog pa dang /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na; thos pas ngoms pa med cing tshul bzhin la rab tu sbyor ba dang / zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos ston pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa shes par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad la sgyu ma lta bur so sor rtog pa dang /
translated: What are the four? They are being insatiable in listening to the Dharma, applying oneself correctly, teaching the Dharma with a mind free of material desires, and discerning all afflictions to be like illusions in order to understand the indivisibility of the realm of phenomena.

original: tshul gcig la 'jug pas thams cad kyi 'jug pa la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: tshul gcig la 'jug pas thams cad kyi 'jug pa la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Engaging in the single principle is to engage in all principles.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
translated: These are the four qualities.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: In this regard, it is said:

analyzed: de dag thos 'tshol ngoms med tshul bzhin rtogs byed cing //
translated: “They are insatiable in seeking to listen to the Dharma and apply themselves correctly.

analyzed: de mnyam ston cing klog 'dzin rnyed pa 'tshol mi byed //
translated: They teach the Dharma equally and do not seek material gain.

analyzed: nyon mongs sprin 'dra sgyu ma rmi lam lta bur blta //
translated: They view afflictions as being like clouds, illusions, and dreams.

original: chos nyid tha dad mi byed de dag tshul gcig 'jug /
analyzed: chos nyid tha dad mi byed de dag tshul gcig 'jug /
translated: They do not differentiate the nature of phenomena and engage in the single principle.

analyzed: tshe bdag chos bzhi de brten khyad par thob 'gyur zhing //

analyzed: shes rab sgron 'das mun bsal zla ltar 'jig rten rgyu //
translated: Like the moon, you dispel the darkness of ignorance in the world.

analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / thos pa thams cad 'dzin pa'i gzungs thob pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi the @164a *//
translated: What are those four?

original: tshom gcod pa'i spobs pa thob pa dang / sems can thams cad la bdag med pa ston pa'i snying rje chen po dang / bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang bral ba mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyi go cha bgos pa ste /
analyzed: tshom gcod pa'i spobs pa thob pa dang / sems can thams cad la bdag med pa ston pa'i snying rje chen po dang / bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang bral ba mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyi go cha bgos pa ste /
translated: They are attaining the dhāraṇī that retains all that is heard, attaining the eloquence that resolves the doubts of all sentient beings, the great compassion that teaches the absence of self to all sentient beings, and the armor of the wisdom of superknowledge that is free from māras and afflictions.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
translated: Those are the four qualities.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /

analyzed: thos kun chud mi za bar 'gyur ba'i gzungs thob cing //
translated: They attain the dhāraṇī that retains all that is heard without loss.

original: de dag spobs ldan sems can som nyi gcod par byed //
analyzed: de dag spobs ldan sems can som nyi gcod par byed //
translated: They are eloquent and resolve the doubts of sentient beings.

original: snying rjes chos 'di thams cad bdag med ston byed cing //
analyzed: snying rjes chos 'di thams cad bdag med ston byed cing //
translated: Through compassion, they teach that all phenomena are devoid of self.

analyzed: mngon shes shes pa'i go bgos bdud kyis mi nyams la //
translated: They are armored in the knowledge of super-knowledge, and Māra cannot overpower them.

translated: Bodhisattvas who engage in these four qualities

analyzed: 'khor kun nang du song yang de la 'jigs pa med //
translated: will not be afraid when they enter the midst of the assembly.

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na thos pas don la rton pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na thos pas don la rton pa rnams yin te /
translated: “Divine son, when great bodhisattva beings possess four qualities, they rely on the meaning of what they hear.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are those four?

original: thos pas thams cad mi 'dzin pas thos pa dang mi ldan zhing sgrub pa nyams pa'i byis pa thams cad yongs su spong ba dang / yi ge dang sgra dang / skad dang / tshig gi lam thams cad mngon du rnam par shes par bya ba'i phyir /

translated: They are to completely abandon all childish beings who do not listen to what they hear and who are devoid of learning and who have lost the practice; to listen to the Dharma in order to understand all the words, sounds, languages, and verbal expressions;

original: gca  dang mtshungs pa nyid du khong du chud pa dang / don 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir thos pa yongs su 'tshol zhing dga' mgur bya ba'i phyir ma yin pa dang / brjod du med pa'i don la 'jug cing brjod pa'i don ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gca  dang mtshungs pa nyid du khong du chud pa dang / don 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir thos pa yongs su 'tshol zhing dga' mgur bya ba'i phyir ma yin pa dang / brjod du med pa'i don la 'jug cing brjod pa'i don ma yin pa ste /
translated: They are: understanding the sameness of all things, seeking learning for the sake of the meaning, not for the sake of mastery over language, and engaging in the meaning that is inexpressible, not in the meaning that is expressed.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
translated: These are the four.

original: de la 'di @164b skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di @164b skad ces bya ste /
translated: About this, the following is said:

original: ji tsam mang du thos kyang don la mi rtog pas //
analyzed: ji tsam mang du thos kyang don la mi rtog pas //
translated: “Though they have heard much, they do not understand the meaning.

original: byis pa thos dang mi ldan rtag tu sgrub chos nyams //
analyzed: byis pa thos dang mi ldan rtag tu sgrub chos nyams //
translated: The childish, lacking learning, always fail to practice the teachings.

original: srid gsum sgra skad dbyangs dang tshig lam gang yod pa //
analyzed: srid gsum sgra skad dbyangs dang tshig lam gang yod pa //
translated: Whatever sounds, voices, melodies, and words there are in the three worlds,

analyzed: brag ca 'dra bar de las don ldan sgra thos nas //
translated: they hear the meaningful sounds that are like echoes.

analyzed: don nyid rtogs shing dga' mgur nyes kun phyir mi 'jug /

analyzed: chos nyid 'di ni don mchog yin te brjod du med //
translated: This reality is the supreme meaning, which is inexpressible.

original: 'di ni don dang sgra skad thos par gyur pa las //
analyzed: 'di ni don dang sgra skad thos par gyur pa las //

original: rtag tu shes rab rnon por gyur cing sngon yang ni //

translated: Therefore, having transcended suffering, they cause others to transcend suffering.

original: ma 'dres pas rnam par thar pa'i sgor zhugs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: ma 'dres pas rnam par thar pa'i sgor zhugs pa rnams yin te /
translated: “Divine son, when bodhisattva great beings possess four qualities, they enter the door of liberation by being unconditioned and unadulterated.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are those four?

original: stong pa nyid spyod yul du gyur cing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid spyod yul du gyur cing /
translated: They are (1) engaging in the domain of emptiness,

analyzed: lta ba'i 'ching bas bcings pa'i sems can rnams thar bar byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la gnas shing rnam par rtog pa spyod pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byad pa dang / smon pa med pa la gnas zhing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsam bzhin du skye ba len pa dang /
translated: (2) liberating sentient beings who are bound by the fetters of views, (3) abiding in the absence of marks while bringing to complete nirvāṇa those who engage in conceptual thoughts, and (4) abiding in the absence of wishes while taking birth intentionally in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: thabs la mkhas shing shes rab kyi nges par byung ba ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas shing shes rab kyi nges par byung ba ste /
translated: They are skilled in means and have the certainty of insight.🔽Those are the four qualities.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo; ;de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo; ;de la 'di skad ces bya ste /

original: stong nyid spyod yul de dag ltas bcing grol byed cing //
analyzed: stong nyid spyod yul de dag ltas bcing grol byed cing //
translated: They are bound by the objects of emptiness, but are liberated by the objects of emptiness.

original: mtshan med gnas shing sems can 'di dag yongs smin byed //
analyzed: mtshan med gnas shing sems can 'di dag yongs smin byed //

original: smon pa med la gnas shing sems can smin bya'i phyir //
analyzed: smon pa med la gnas shing sems can smin bya'i phyir //
translated: They abide in the wishless, but intentionally take birth in order to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: bsam bzhin skye zhing gang du 'dod pa der skye 'gyur //
analyzed: bsam bzhin skye zhing gang du 'dod pa der skye 'gyur //

analyzed: shes rab thabs kyis nges byung rnam thar sgor gnas kyang /
translated: They abide in the gateway of liberation that arises through wisdom and skillful means,

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i dbyings ni dus min thob mi byed //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i dbyings ni dus min thob mi byed //
translated: but they do not attain the unconditioned realm prematurely.

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na lhag pa'i nga rgyal can tshar gcod pa'i phyir snrel zhir bsgrub pa la mkhas pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na lhag pa'i nga rgyal can tshar gcod pa'i phyir snrel zhir bsgrub pa la mkhas pa rnams yin te /
translated: “Divine son, when bodhisattva great beings have four qualities, they are skilled in the way of subduing the proud in order to defeat them.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are those four?

original: chos kyi dbyings kun nas sgo yang dag par shes pa dang / chos thams cad sgrib pa med par mos pa dang / kun tu rtog pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i @168b nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chos thams cad la nem nur med pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kun nas sgo yang dag par shes pa dang / chos thams cad sgrib pa med par mos pa dang / kun tu rtog pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i @168b nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chos thams cad la nem nur med pa ste /
translated: the knowledge of the pure gateway of the realm of phenomena, the aspiration to all phenomena without obscuration, the knowledge of the afflictions that arise from the root of conceptualization, and the absence of doubt regarding all phenomena, which are by nature nirvāṇa.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
translated: “These are the four qualities.🔽“In this regard, it is said:

analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste; sems mnyam chos kyi dbyings su nges par byung gyur cing //
translated: The mind is equal, and it is certain that it arises from the realm of phenomena.

original: de dag rnams kyis sgrib pa 'ga' yang mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyis sgrib pa 'ga' yang mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: They do not see any obscurations at all.

original: nyon mongs kun tu rtog pa'i rtsa las rab byung bar //
analyzed: nyon mongs kun tu rtog pa'i rtsa las rab byung bar //
translated: The afflictions arise from the root of conceptualization.

original: shes nas de las snrel zhir kun tu ston mi byed //
analyzed: shes nas de las snrel zhir kun tu ston mi byed //
translated: Knowing this, they do not display it as a diversity.🔽All these phenomena are by nature nirvāṇa,

analyzed: chos 'di thams cad rang bzhin mya ngan 'das pa dang // ma skyes ma 'gag ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa yin //
translated: unborn, unceasing, and pure by nature.

original: de dag kun mkhyen yongs btsal mya ngan 'das gyur nas //
analyzed: de dag kun mkhyen yongs btsal mya ngan 'das gyur nas //
translated: Having sought out the Omniscient One, they have passed beyond suffering.

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal can dag tshar gcod byed pa yin //
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal can dag tshar gcod byed pa yin //
translated: They are the ones who defeat those with excessive pride.

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na las kyi bya ba thams cad kyi rgyu la mkhas pa rnams yin te /

translated: “Divine son, when bodhisattva great beings have four qualities, they are skilled in the causes of all their actions.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are those four?

original: longs spyod chen po'i rgyu sbyin pa mi spong ba dang / mtho ris su skye ba'i rgyu tshul khrims mi spong ba dang / shes rab chen po'i rgyu thos pa mi spong ba dang / bral ba'i rgyu sgom pa mi spong ba ste /
analyzed: longs spyod chen po'i rgyu sbyin pa mi spong ba dang / mtho ris su skye ba'i rgyu tshul khrims mi spong ba dang / shes rab chen po'i rgyu thos pa mi spong ba dang / bral ba'i rgyu sgom pa mi spong ba ste /
translated: They are not abandoning generosity, which is the cause of great wealth; they are not abandoning discipline, which is the cause of being born in the higher realms; they are not abandoning listening, which is the cause of great insight; and they are not abandoning meditation, which is the cause of freedom.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
translated: Those are the four qualities.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /

analyzed: longs spyod che rgyu sbyin pa mi spong de'i 'bras de //
translated: Not abandoning generosity, which is the cause of great wealth, is its result.

original: mtho ris skye rgyu tshul khrims thob cing de'i 'bras de //
analyzed: mtho ris skye rgyu tshul khrims thob cing de'i 'bras de //
translated: Not abandoning discipline, which is the cause of being born in the higher realms, is its result.

original: shes rab nyon mongs 'joms rgyu thos pa de'i 'bras de //
analyzed: shes rab nyon mongs 'joms rgyu thos pa de'i 'bras de //
translated: Not abandoning listening, which is the cause of destroying the afflictions with insight, is its result.

original: rnam grol rig rgyu sgom par byed cing de 'bras de //
analyzed: rnam grol rig rgyu sgom par byed cing de 'bras de //
translated: They meditate on the cause of the knowledge of liberation and its result.

analyzed: rgyu bzhi de la rtog brtson @169a *//
translated: Those who are diligent in understanding the four causes

original: mkhas pa de dag ni //
analyzed: mkhas pa de dag ni //
translated: are wise.

analyzed: byang chub snying por dbang bskur 'bras phyir nyin mtshan spyod //
translated: Day and night, they practice for the sake of the result of empowerment at the essence of enlightenment.

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan lta ba'i rnam pa dang bral zhing rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan lta ba'i rnam pa dang bral zhing rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa rnams yin te /
translated: “Divine son, when bodhisattva great beings possess four qualities, they are free from the view of the transitory collection and are skilled in dependent origination.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are those four?

original: chad par smra ba ma yin pa dang / rtag par smra ba ma yin pa dang / ma rig pa byang na rga shi'i bar du 'byung bar lta zhing bdag tu lta bar mi byed pa dang / ma rig pa 'gags na rga shi'i bar du 'gags par lta zhing srid pa 'gog par yang mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: chad par smra ba ma yin pa dang / rtag par smra ba ma yin pa dang / ma rig pa byang na rga shi'i bar du 'byung bar lta zhing bdag tu lta bar mi byed pa dang / ma rig pa 'gags na rga shi'i bar du 'gags par lta zhing srid pa 'gog par yang mi byed pa ste /
translated: They do not propound annihilation, they do not propound permanence, they see that when ignorance ceases, aging and death will cease, and they do not bring about the cessation of existence.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
translated: Those are the four qualities.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: This is what is meant by that:

analyzed: nam yang rtag par mi lta chad par ltung mi byed // des ni chos rnams rkyen byung byed pa po dang ni //
translated: Never view them as permanent or falling into annihilation.🔽They know that phenomena arise from conditions, and that there is no creator

original: tshor ba po med rang bzhin rnam par dag par shes //
analyzed: tshor ba po med rang bzhin rnam par dag par shes //
translated: And no experiencer, but that their nature is pure.

original: ma rig rtsa las rga shi'i bar du 'byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: ma rig rtsa las rga shi'i bar du 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: From the root of ignorance up to aging and death,

analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyis gsungs te de 'gags rgyu dang ni //

analyzed: rkyen zad de phyir phyin chad skye mi 'gyur zhes gsungs //

analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa rnams yin te /
translated: “Divine son, when bodhisattva great beings possess four qualities, they are skilled in the means to ripen sentient beings.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are those four?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la rag las par lta ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsags pa la skyo ba @169b med pa dang / 'khro ba'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo yongs su 'tshol ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la rag las par lta ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsags pa la skyo ba @169b med pa dang / 'khro ba'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo yongs su 'tshol ba dang /
translated: They are (1) the view that all sentient beings are dependent, (2) the absence of weariness in the accumulation of roots of virtue, (3) the pursuit of the gateway to nirvāṇa through cyclic existence, and (4) the absence of pride in the face of their own qualities.

original: sems can rnams kyi mos pa ji lta ba de lta bu'i mos pa thabs gyis nyams su myong bar byed cing nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mos pa ji lta ba de lta bu'i mos pa thabs gyis nyams su myong bar byed cing nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma yin pa ste /
translated: They experience the various kinds of interest of sentient beings through skillful means, not through their own afflictive emotions.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
translated: These are the four.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: On this topic, it is said:

original: sangs rgyas byang chub 'di ni sems can rnams la rten /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub 'di ni sems can rnams la rten /

original: dge ba gsog cing 'dod pas yongs su skyo ba med //
analyzed: dge ba gsog cing 'dod pas yongs su skyo ba med //

analyzed: 'khor ba'i sgo nas mya ngan 'das pa yongs 'tshol zhing //
translated: They seek nirvana through the door of samsara.

analyzed: sems can ji bzhin mos pa thabs kyis yongs su shes //
translated: They know the various kinds of interest of sentient beings through skillful means.

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho ba rnams yin te /
translated: “Divine Prince, when bodhisattva great beings have four qualities, they are a support for all sentient beings.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: longs spyod mi zad pa dang / chos ston pa mi zad pa dang / mngon par shes pa thob pa dang / sems sa ltar mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod mi zad pa dang / chos ston pa mi zad pa dang / mngon par shes pa thob pa dang / sems sa ltar mnyam pa ste /
translated: They have inexhaustible wealth, inexhaustible Dharma teachings, they attain the superknowledges, and their minds are like the earth.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
translated: These are the four.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /

analyzed: de dag rnams kyi longs spyod rtag tu mi zad cing //

analyzed: mya ngan ma 'das gang la chos rnams de yod pa //
translated: And for those who have not attained nirvana, they possess the Dharma.

analyzed: de dag 'gro ba kun gyi nye bar 'tsho 'gyur zhing // byang chub mchog phyir myur du nges @170a *//
translated: They become the support for all beings,

original: par 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: par 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: And quickly attain definite emergence for the sake of supreme enlightenment.

translated: Divine son, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas possess four qualities, they become objects of worship for the entire world.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are those four?

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhis nas pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sdud pa dang / bden pa bzhi shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhis nas pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sdud pa dang / bden pa bzhi shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa ste /

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
translated: These are the four dharmas.

translated: What are those four? They are the love that comes from the wisdom of the superknowledges, the eloquence that is the intention of all buddhas, never being separated from any virtue and being free from habitual tendencies, and being endowed with all virtuous qualities and receiving empowerment.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ngo //
translated: Those are the four qualities.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /

analyzed: de dag kha na ma tho med pa'i yon tan ldan //

analyzed: klu rnams kyis kyang mu tig dmar po dang / klu'i me tog gi char rab tu phab bo //

analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod kyang chos sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag gi don dang / tshig rnam par gtan la dbab pa de la spobs par gyis shig /

analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa rnams @173a *//

original: yin; 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: yin; 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /

analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa 'di bshad pa na byang chub sems dpa' lnga khri brgyad stong gis mi skye ba'i chos lung bstan pa la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: When Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta had given this teaching, fifty-eight thousand bodhisattvas attained acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: lha dang / mi rnams kyi skye dgu bdun khri nyis stong ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: lha dang / mi rnams kyi skye dgu bdun khri nyis stong ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: Seventy-two thousand beings of the gods and humans attained the stainless and immaculate Dharma eye with regard to phenomena.

original: srog chags 'bum lhag tsam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems @179a *//
analyzed: srog chags 'bum lhag tsam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems @179a *//
translated: More than one hundred thousand beings generated the mind of unexcelled and complete awakening.

original: bskyed do // 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la mchod pa'i phyir lha rnams kyis kyang steng gi bar snang las lha'i me tog gi char dag mngon par rab tu phab bo //
analyzed: bskyed do // 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la mchod pa'i phyir lha rnams kyis kyang steng gi bar snang las lha'i me tog gi char dag mngon par rab tu phab bo //
translated: In order to make offerings to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, the gods caused a rain of divine flowers to fall from the sky above.

original: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor rnams kyis kyang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa 'di thos nas yi rangs pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas tshig 'di skad ces bdag cag gis kyang chos de dag thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor rnams kyis kyang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa 'di thos nas yi rangs pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas tshig 'di skad ces bdag cag gis kyang chos de dag thob par gyur cig /
translated: The entire retinue, having heard this teaching of Mañjuśrīkumārabhūta, rejoiced and, with happy minds, said these words: “May we also attain those dharmas!

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i spobs pa ji lta ba de lta bu'i spobs pa mi chod pa'ang thob par gyur cig ces smras so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i spobs pa ji lta ba de lta bu'i spobs pa mi chod pa'ang thob par gyur cig ces smras so //
translated: May we attain the same unimpeded eloquence as Mañjuśrīkumārabhūta!”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la /
translated: The Blessed One also said to Mañjuśrīkumārabhūta:

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis chos rnam par gtan la dbab pa bstan pa 'di legs par smras te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis chos rnam par gtan la dbab pa bstan pa 'di legs par smras te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, you have spoken well this Dharma instruction on ascertaining phenomena.

original: legs so // legs so zhes bya ba byin no ////
analyzed: legs so // legs so zhes bya ba byin no ////
translated: Excellent, excellent!”

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Chapter Two

original: de nas lha'i bu rab rtsal sems kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu rab rtsal sems kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the god Suvikrāntavikrāmin said to Mañjuśrīkumārabhūta:

original: 'jam dpal / ci khyod kho bo las chos kyis dgab pa 'dod dam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ci khyod kho bo las chos kyis dgab pa 'dod dam /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, do you wish to be covered by the Dharma from me?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / 'di skad du khyod chos kyi dgab pa 'dod dam zhes zer pa ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di skad du khyod chos kyi dgab pa 'dod dam zhes zer pa ni /
translated: “Divine son, you ask, ‘Do you wish for the Dharma’s covering?’

original: lha'i bu / legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la chos kyi dgab pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang / 'dod pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la chos kyi dgab pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang / 'dod pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: Divine son, in this well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya, the so-called Dharma’s covering is the abandonment of craving and desire.

original: chos 'di ni so sor rtogs pa med @179b pa'i phyir 'dod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni so sor rtogs pa med @179b pa'i phyir 'dod pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is desireless because it is not individually cognized.

original: chos 'di ni mig gi lam las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ltar mi snang ba yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni mig gi lam las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ltar mi snang ba yin no //
translated: This Dharma is invisible because it is beyond the path of the eye.

original: chos 'di ni mngon par grub pa med pa'i phyir ma byas pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni mngon par grub pa med pa'i phyir ma byas pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is unmade because it is not established.

original: chos 'di ni yul drug dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir mi mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni yul drug dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir mi mthong ba yin no //
translated: This Dharma is not seen because it is not mixed with the six sense objects.

original: chos 'di ni sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir bdag gi ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir bdag gi ba med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is not possessed because it is free from mind, mentality, and consciousness.

original: chos 'di ni gtan yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir gzung ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni gtan yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir gzung ba med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is ungraspable because it is never fully established.

original: chos 'di ni yul med pa'i yul du 'gro ba'i phyir gzhi med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni yul med pa'i yul du 'gro ba'i phyir gzhi med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is groundless because it goes to the groundless object.

original: chos 'di ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir zag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir zag pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is without outflows because it is isolated from its own nature.

original: chos 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'ong ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'ong ba med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is without coming because the prior limit is purified.

original: chos 'di ni phyi ma'i mtha' rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'gro ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni phyi ma'i mtha' rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'gro ba med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is without going because the later limit is purified.

original: chos 'di ni da ltar byung ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir gnas pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni da ltar byung ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir gnas pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is without abiding because the present is purified.

original: chos 'di ni brtag cing sel ba dang bral ba'i phyir rtsol ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni brtag cing sel ba dang bral ba'i phyir rtsol ba med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is without effort because it is free from investigation and analysis.

original: chos 'di ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir mnyam pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir mnyam pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is without equality because it is equal to space.

original: chos 'di ni gnyen po med pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni gnyen po med pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is without inequality and without equality because it is without antidote.

original: chos 'di ni bdud kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir g-yo ba med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / ma brtag pa dang / rnam par ma brtag pa dang / rnam par ma bsgrub pa dang / kun tu ma bstan @180a *//🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni bdud kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir g-yo ba med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / ma brtag pa dang / rnam par ma brtag pa dang / rnam par ma bsgrub pa dang / kun tu ma bstan @180a *// pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is unmoving, free of conceit, uninvestigated, unanalyzed, unestablished, and unproclaimed, because it transcends all the domains of Māra.

original: chos 'di ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba'i phyir blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba'i phyir blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is free of acceptance and rejection, because it is free of arising and destruction.

original: chos 'di ni chos kyi dbyings su yang dag par gzhol ba'i phyir gnas pa med par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni chos kyi dbyings su yang dag par gzhol ba'i phyir gnas pa med par gnas pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma abides without abiding, because it is directed toward the realm of phenomena.

original: chos 'di ni yang dag par ma byung ba'i phyir dbyer med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni yang dag par ma byung ba'i phyir dbyer med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is indivisible, because it is not really arisen.

original: chos 'di ni spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir rab tu spyod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir rab tu spyod pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is not really practiced, because it is free of conceptual elaboration.

original: chos 'di ni rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba'i phyir spros pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba'i phyir spros pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: This Dharma is free of conceptual elaboration, because it is naturally peaceful.

original: chos 'di ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nye bar zhi ba yin no; ;chos 'di ni phas kyi rgol ba thams cad nges par bcom pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nye bar zhi ba yin no; ;chos 'di ni phas kyi rgol ba thams cad nges par bcom pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is peaceful because it is free from all conceptualization. This Dharma is non-conceptual because it has definitely conquered all opponents.

original: chos 'di ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi rdul dang bral ba'i phyir shin tu 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi rdul dang bral ba'i phyir shin tu 'phags pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is exalted because it is free from the dust of desire and attachment.

original: chos 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi phyir stong pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi phyir stong pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is not empty because it is emptiness.

original: chos 'di ni nges par ma brtags pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni nges par ma brtags pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is signless because it is not a sign.

original: chos 'di ni rnam par shes pa mi gnas pa'i phyir smon pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni rnam par shes pa mi gnas pa'i phyir smon pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is wishless because consciousness does not abide.

original: chos 'di ni rtsa ba yongs su chad pa'i phyir mi gnas pa yin no //🔽chos 'di ni grogs med pa'i phyir mi rten pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni rtsa ba yongs su chad pa'i phyir mi gnas pa yin no // chos 'di ni grogs med pa'i phyir mi rten pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is not abiding because its roots are cut.🔽This Dharma is not supported because it has no companion.

original: chos 'di ni mi rten pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni mi rten pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: This Dharma is not moving because it is not supported.

original: chos 'di ni bzod ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni bzod ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is selfless because it is pure from the beginning.

original: chos 'di ni gtan mngon par grub pa med pa'i @180b phyir sems can med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni gtan mngon par grub pa med pa'i @180b phyir sems can med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is without sentient beings because it is ultimately non-arisen.

original: chos 'di ni gzod ma nas ma byung ba'i phyir rtag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni gzod ma nas ma byung ba'i phyir rtag pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is permanent because it is primordially non-arisen.

original: chos 'di ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ma byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ma byung ba yin no //
translated: This Dharma is non-arisen because it is primordially unborn.

original: chos 'di ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is unborn because it is free from characteristics.

original: chos 'di ni mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa yin no //🔽chos 'di ni gzod ma nas yang dag par rgyun chad pa'i phyir zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa yin no // chos 'di ni gzod ma nas yang dag par rgyun chad pa'i phyir zhi ba yin no //
translated: This Dharma is without characteristics because it is free from all characteristics.🔽This Dharma is peace because it is primordially perfectly severed.

original: chos 'di ni gzod ma nas nye bar zhi ba'i phyir yang dag par rgyun chad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni gzod ma nas nye bar zhi ba'i phyir yang dag par rgyun chad pa med pa yin no //
translated: This Dharma is perfectly severed because it is primordially pacified.

original: chos 'di ni mi phyed pa dang / mi snang ba'i phyir nam mkha'i mtshan nyid lta bu yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni mi phyed pa dang / mi snang ba'i phyir nam mkha'i mtshan nyid lta bu yin no //
translated: This Dharma is like the characteristic of space because it is indivisible and non-apparent.

original: lha'i bu / chos de lta bu la chos kyi dgab pa de lta bu zhig yod /
analyzed: lha'i bu / chos de lta bu la chos kyi dgab pa de lta bu zhig yod /
translated: Divine son, such a Dharma has such a Dharma robe.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / chos 'di'i dgab pa ni kun tu 'phro ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos 'di'i dgab pa ni kun tu 'phro ba med pa yin no //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, the robe of this Dharma is non-diffusion.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / legs so //
analyzed: lha'i bu / legs so //
translated: “Divine son, excellent, excellent!

original: legs so // ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: legs so // ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: chos 'di'i dgab pa ni gang la lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyis rtul ba med pa de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di'i dgab pa ni gang la lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyis rtul ba med pa de lta bu yin no //
translated: The robe of this Dharma is such that one does not engage in it with body, speech, or mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos 'di ni gsal ba rnyog pa med pa yin pas de ni sems rnyog pa can gyis chod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos 'di ni gsal ba rnyog pa med pa yin pas de ni sems rnyog pa can gyis chod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this Dharma is clear and unclouded, and it cannot be obscured by a mind that is clouded.

original: lha'i bus smras pa; 'jam dpal /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa; 'jam dpal /
translated: The god said,

original: ji ltar na sems rnyog pa can yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems rnyog pa can yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, how is the mind clouded?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / gzugs kyi mtshan ma rjes su dran pas sangs rgyas rjes su dran par byed pa'i @181a *//
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzugs kyi mtshan ma rjes su dran pas sangs rgyas rjes su dran par byed pa'i @181a *//
translated: “Divine son, a mind that recollects the Buddha by recollecting the characteristics of form

original: sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: is a clouded mind.

original: sgra dang / skad dang / dbyangs dang / tshig gi lam gyis chos rjes su dran par byed pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang / skad dang / dbyangs dang / tshig gi lam gyis chos rjes su dran par byed pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind that recalls the Dharma by means of sounds, languages, tones, and expressions is a muddled mind.

original: 'bras bu thob pa mngon du byed pas dge 'dun rjes su dran par byed pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa mngon du byed pas dge 'dun rjes su dran par byed pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind that recalls the Saṅgha by manifesting the attainment of the fruits is a muddled mind.

original: nyon mongs pa gtan spong ba rjes su dran par byed pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gtan spong ba rjes su dran par byed pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind that recalls the abandonment of the afflictions is a muddled mind.

original: skye ba la rten pas lha rjes su dran par byed pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la rten pas lha rjes su dran par byed pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind that recalls the gods by being attached to birth is a muddled mind.

original: ma dul ba'i sbyin pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: ma dul ba'i sbyin pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of generosity that is not disciplined is a muddled mind.

original: ma zhi ba'i tshul khrims kyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: ma zhi ba'i tshul khrims kyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of discipline that is not peaceful is a muddled mind.

original: sems can la brten pa'i bzod pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no; ;spros pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: sems can la brten pa'i bzod pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no; ;spros pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of patience that is based on sentient beings is a muddled mind. The mind of wisdom that is conceptual is a muddled mind.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa'i byams pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa'i byams pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of love that is based on the belief in a self is a defiled mind.

original: sems la nges par ma bsam pa'i bsam gtan gyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: sems la nges par ma bsam pa'i bsam gtan gyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of concentration that is not directed to the thought of the mind is a defiled mind.

original: the tshom gyi snying rje'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: the tshom gyi snying rje'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of compassion that is based on doubt is a defiled mind.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang bral ba'i dga' ba'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang bral ba'i dga' ba'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of joy that is divorced from the path of the transcendence of suffering is a defiled mind.

original: gnyis la gnas pa'i btang snyoms kyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //🔽lus su 'du @181b shes pa'i tshor ba'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //🔽chos su 'du shes pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: gnyis la gnas pa'i btang snyoms kyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no // lus su 'du @181b shes pa'i tshor ba'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no // chos su 'du shes pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of equanimity that is based on duality is a defiled mind.🔽The mind of the meditative development of the applications of mindfulness that is based on the belief in a real personality is a defiled mind.🔽The mind of the applications of mindfulness that is based on the belief in the reality of the psychophysical existence is a defiled mind.

original: skye ba dang / 'jig par 'du shes pa'i yang dag par spong ba'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'jig par 'du shes pa'i yang dag par spong ba'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of the correct exertions that is based on the belief in the reality of the psychophysical existence is a defiled mind.

original: lus dang sems la rten pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: lus dang sems la rten pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of the bases of psychic power that are based on body and mind is a defiled mind.

original: dbang po drug la rten pa'i dbang po lnga'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: dbang po drug la rten pa'i dbang po lnga'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of the five faculties that are based on the six faculties is a defiled mind.

original: lta ba'i stobs dang ldan pa'i stobs lnga'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i stobs dang ldan pa'i stobs lnga'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of the five powers that are endowed with the power of view is a defiled mind.

original: chos su 'du shes pa la gnas pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: chos su 'du shes pa la gnas pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of the factors of awakening that are based on the perception of phenomena is a defiled mind.

original: 'du byed yid la byed pa la brtson pa'i lam sgom pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //🔽sdug bsngal la yongs su rtog pa'i 'du shes can gyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //🔽kun 'byung ba la sgom pa'i 'du shes can gyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed yid la byed pa la brtson pa'i lam sgom pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no // sdug bsngal la yongs su rtog pa'i 'du shes can gyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no // kun 'byung ba la sgom pa'i 'du shes can gyi sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind of the cultivation of the path that is based on the application of attention to volitional factors is a defiled mind.🔽The mind that has the perception of fully understanding suffering is a defiled mind.🔽The mind that has the perception of cultivating the origin [of suffering] is a defiled mind.

original: 'gog pa zad par 'du shes pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa zad par 'du shes pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: The mind that has the perception of exhausting cessation is a defiled mind.

original: lam la sgom par 'du shes pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin te /
analyzed: lam la sgom par 'du shes pa'i sems ni sems rnyog pa can yin te /
translated: The mind that perceives the path as something to be cultivated is a polluted mind.

original: lha'i bu / ji tsam du rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa nyid la sgro 'dogs par byed pa de tsam du sems rnyog pa can yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / ji tsam du rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa nyid la sgro 'dogs par byed pa de tsam du sems rnyog pa can yin no //
translated: Son of the gods, to the extent that you superimpose on what is naturally pure, to that extent your mind is polluted.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The son of the gods said:

original: 'jam dpal / sems rnyog pa med pa gang dag yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sems rnyog pa med pa gang dag yin /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what are unpolluted minds?

original: 'jam @182a *// dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam @182a *// dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / gang dag sems nam mkha' dang mnyam pa dag go /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang dag sems nam mkha' dang mnyam pa dag go /
translated: Son of the gods, those whose minds are equal to space.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The son of the gods said:

original: 'jam dpal / nam mkha' la sems cung zad kyang yod dam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / nam mkha' la sems cung zad kyang yod dam /
translated: Mañjuśrī, is there even the slightest mind in space?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / ji ltar nam mkha' la sems med pa bzhin du sems de'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / ji ltar nam mkha' la sems med pa bzhin du sems de'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Son of the gods, just as there is no mind in space, that mind is like that.

original: gang gi sems de 'dra ba de ni sems nam mkha' dang mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi sems de 'dra ba de ni sems nam mkha' dang mnyam pa yin no //
translated: One whose mind is like that has a mind that is equal to space.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The son of the gods said:

original: 'jam dpal / gnas de la su zhig mos par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gnas de la su zhig mos par 'gyur /
translated: Mañjuśrī, who believes in that state?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / lhag par byed pa la brtson pa rnams kyis mos par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / lhag par byed pa la brtson pa rnams kyis mos par dka' ba yin no //
translated: Divine son, it is difficult for those who strive to make something special to have interest in it.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / lhag par byed pa zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / lhag par byed pa zhes bya ba de ji lta bu yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, what is this ‘making something special’ that you speak of?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / gang sems nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir lhag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang sems nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir lhag par byed pa'o //
translated: “Divine son, it is making something special because the mind is the same as space.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / ci zhig lhag par byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ci zhig lhag par byed pa yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, what is made special?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / rtag par byed pa ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / rtag par byed pa ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
translated: “Divine son, making something permanent is making something special.

original: mi rtag par byed pa ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag par byed pa ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
translated: Making something impermanent is making something special.

original: de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / bdag dang / bdag med par byed pa ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / bdag dang / bdag med par byed pa ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, making something pleasant, painful, attractive, unattractive, a self, or a non-self is making something special.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba dang / gang zag ces bya ba de ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba dang / gang zag ces bya ba de ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
translated: Making something empty and making something a person is making something special.

original: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya ba @182b de ni lhag par byed pa yin no //🔽sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / chu zla dang / smig rgyu dang / sprul pa'i dpe nye bar dgod pa dag gi chos rnam par 'jog par byed /🔽mtshon par byed /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya ba @182b de ni lhag par byed pa yin no // sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / chu zla dang / smig rgyu dang / sprul pa'i dpe nye bar dgod pa dag gi chos rnam par 'jog par byed / mtshon par byed /
translated: The terms “signless” and “wishless” are used to emphasize this.

original: 'jug par byed /
analyzed: 'jug par byed /
translated: He establishes, demonstrates, introduces, and teaches the Dharma by means of the examples of illusions, dreams, optical illusions, reflections, echoes, the moon in the water, mirages, and magical incarnations.

original: ston par byed pa de ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ston par byed pa de ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
translated: This is how he emphasizes.

original: de ji tsam du chos rnam par 'jog par byed pa de tsam du lhag par byed pa yin te /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa la skyon du byed pa dang / rnam par byang ba la skyon med par byed pa de ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ji tsam du chos rnam par 'jog par byed pa de tsam du lhag par byed pa yin te / kun nas nyon mongs pa la skyon du byed pa dang / rnam par byang ba la skyon med par byed pa de ni lhag par byed pa yin no //
translated: He emphasizes to the extent that he establishes the Dharma.🔽He emphasizes the faults of the afflictions and the virtues of purification.

original: 'khor ba la skyon du lta bar byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la phan yon du lta bar byed pa de ni lhag par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba la skyon du lta bar byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la phan yon du lta bar byed pa de ni lhag par byed pa yin te /
translated: He emphasizes the faults of cyclic existence and the virtues of nirvana.

original: lha'i bu / de dag ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyis lhag par byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de dag ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyis lhag par byed pa dag yin no //
translated: Divine son, these are the things that those with excessive pride do.

original: lha'i bus smras pa; 'jam dpal /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa; 'jam dpal /
translated: The god said, “Mañjuśrī,

original: ji ltar na lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa yin /
translated: how is it that one is without excessive pride?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu gang gis nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings rtogs shing nyon mongs pa thams cad 'gog pa bsgrubs te gnas kyang 'gog pa 'gog par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: lha'i bu gang gis nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings rtogs shing nyon mongs pa thams cad 'gog pa bsgrubs te gnas kyang 'gog pa 'gog par yang mi byed la /
translated: “Divine son, when one realizes the realm of nirvāṇa and accomplishes the cessation of all afflictions, one abides in that state without causing cessation to cease.

original: skye ba med pa bskyed par yang mi byed cing /
analyzed: skye ba med pa bskyed par yang mi byed cing /
translated: One does not cause the unborn to arise.

original: sgra thams cad kyis skrag par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyis skrag par yang mi byed la /
translated: One is not frightened by any sound.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa de ltar shes shing chos thams cad la gnyis dang bral ba dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor b @183a *//🔽med pa thob pa de ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa de ltar shes shing chos thams cad la gnyis dang bral ba dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor b @183a *// med pa thob pa de ni /
translated: One knows that the nature of the afflictions is the nature of purification, and one attains all phenomena free from duality, free from adopting and rejecting.

original: lha'i bu / lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa yin no //
translated: Divine son, that is how one is without excessive pride.”

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa 'di bshad pa na lha'i bu nyi khri nyis stong chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa 'di bshad pa na lha'i bu nyi khri nyis stong chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: When Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta had expounded this teaching, twenty-two thousand gods purified the stainless and immaculate Dharma eye with regard to phenomena.

original: dge slong lnga stong ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong lnga stong ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: Five thousand monks were liberated from defilements without grasping.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyi khri nyis stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyi khri nyis stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Twenty-two thousand bodhisattvas attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: srog chags stong phrag rab tu mang po dag gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //🔽dge bsnyen stong yang chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: srog chags stong phrag rab tu mang po dag gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do // dge bsnyen stong yang chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: Many thousands of beings generated the mind of unexcelled and complete awakening.🔽One thousand male and female lay practitioners purified the stainless and immaculate Dharma eye with regard to phenomena.

original: khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba las bud med nyis stong yang chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba las bud med nyis stong yang chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: Two thousand women, both lay and ordained, purified the stainless and immaculate Dharma eye with regard to phenomena.

original: de nas lha'i bu rab rtsal sems kyis nyan thos chen po de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu rab rtsal sems kyis nyan thos chen po de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the devaputra Suvikranta spoke to the great sravakas:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: “Venerable ones,

original: khyed cag kyang the tshom ci yod pa dag 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la dris shig /
analyzed: khyed cag kyang the tshom ci yod pa dag 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la dris shig /
translated: you should ask Manjushri Kumara about whatever doubts you have.”

original: de nas gnas brtan 'od srung chen pos 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan 'od srung chen pos 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the elder Mahakasyapa said to Manjushri Kumara:

original: 'jam dpal / dge slong rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan byed pa ji zhig la bsam gtan byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge slong rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan byed pa ji zhig la bsam gtan byed pa yin /
translated: “Manjushri, when a bhikshu meditates on the eight liberations, what does he meditate on?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Manjushri replied:

original: @183b btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: @183b btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: “Venerable Mahakasyapa,

original: dge slong rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan byed pa ni rtsa ba med pa dang / mtha' med pa dang / gnas med pa la bsam gtan byed pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa la bsam gtan byed pa dang / yang dag pa la bsam gtan byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan byed pa ni rtsa ba med pa dang / mtha' med pa dang / gnas med pa la bsam gtan byed pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa la bsam gtan byed pa dang / yang dag pa la bsam gtan byed pa yin no //
translated: a bhikshu who meditates on the eight liberations meditates on the rootless, the endless, the groundless, the imperturbable, and the true.”

original: 'od srung chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: 'od srung chen pos smras pa /
translated: Mahakasyapa said:🔽“Manjushri,

original: 'jam dpal / ci las bsams te de skad smra /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ci las bsams te de skad smra /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what do you think when you say this?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: “Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: rtsa ba ni rang gi lus yin /
analyzed: rtsa ba ni rang gi lus yin /
translated: the root is one’s own body.

original: mtha' ni ngar 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: mtha' ni ngar 'dzin pa yin /
translated: The end is the grasping of ‘I.’

original: gnas ni khams gsum pa yin /
analyzed: gnas ni khams gsum pa yin /
translated: The abode is the three realms.

original: 'khrugs pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams yin /
analyzed: 'khrugs pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams yin /
translated: The disturbance is the afflictions.

original: mi mnyam pa ni gnyis yin te /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni gnyis yin te /
translated: The unevenness is duality.

original: de la des lus ni rtsa ba med par shes /
analyzed: de la des lus ni rtsa ba med par shes /
translated: In this regard, one should know that the body is rootless.

original: ngar 'dzin pa ni mtha' med par shes /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa ni mtha' med par shes /
translated: One should know that the grasping of ‘I’ is endless.

original: khams gsum ni gnas med par shes /
analyzed: khams gsum ni gnas med par shes /
translated: One should know that the three realms are groundless.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni mi 'khrugs par shes /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni mi 'khrugs par shes /
translated: One should know that the afflictions are undisturbed.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni gnyis su med par shes pas na /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni gnyis su med par shes pas na /
translated: One should know that the concentrations are nondual.

original: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: kho bos de las bsams nas dge slong rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan byed pa ni rtsa ba med pa dang / mtha' med pa dang / gnas med pa la bsam gtan byed pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa la bsam gtan byed pa dang /
analyzed: kho bos de las bsams nas dge slong rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan byed pa ni rtsa ba med pa dang / mtha' med pa dang / gnas med pa la bsam gtan byed pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa la bsam gtan byed pa dang /
translated: I think of this when I say that the monks who practice concentration on the eight liberations practice concentration on the rootless, the endless, the groundless, and the undisturbed.

original: yang dag pa la bsam gtan byed pa yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: yang dag pa la bsam gtan byed pa yin no zhes smras so //
translated: They are practicing meditation on the real.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chags pa med pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chags pa med pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, how do bodhisattvas possess non-attached wisdom?”

original: 'jam @184a *// dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam @184a *// dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang chags pa thams cad la spyod par byed kyang chags pa thams cad kyis gos par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang chags pa thams cad la spyod par byed kyang chags pa thams cad kyis gos par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: when bodhisattvas engage in all attachments but are not tainted by any attachments,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad la mngon sum du byed kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa de dag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag kyang spong bar mi byed na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad la mngon sum du byed kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa de dag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag kyang spong bar mi byed na /
translated: and when they manifest all afflictions but do not abandon those afflictions that are the nature of those afflictions in order to ripen sentient beings,

original: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' chags pa med pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' chags pa med pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: then, to that extent, bodhisattvas possess non-attached wisdom.”

original: moonggal gyi bu chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu chen pos smras pa /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana said,

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul che ba yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul che ba yin /
translated: Mañjuśrī, how is it that bodhisattvas have great miraculous abilities?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: btsun pa moonggal gyi bu chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa moonggal gyi bu chen po /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang 'dus byas kyang ma thob /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang 'dus byas kyang ma thob /
translated: bodhisattvas do not attain the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma thob la slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams kyang 'dul bar byed na de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul che ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma thob la slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams kyang 'dul bar byed na de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul che ba yin no //
translated: nor do they attain the unconditioned, yet they train and discipline those who are training and those who are beyond training. To that extent, bodhisattvas have great miraculous abilities.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, how is it that bodhisattvas remain free of afflictions?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad sgrib pa med par shes par byed pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad sgrib pa med par shes par byed pa /
translated: when bodhisattvas understand that all phenomena are free of obscurations,

original: pha rol dang / tshur rol dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: pha rol dang / tshur rol dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: they are free from the far shore and this shore.

original: byang chub kyi sgrib pa'ang mi spong la ting nge @184b 'dzin las kyang mi ldang zhing bya ba thams cad ston par byed na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sgrib pa'ang mi spong la ting nge @184b 'dzin las kyang mi ldang zhing bya ba thams cad ston par byed na /
translated: He does not abandon the obscurations to enlightenment, but he does not rise from meditative absorption, and he manifests all activities.

original: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa yin no //
translated: To that extent, the bodhisattva abides without afflictions.

original: byams ma'i bu gang pos smras pa /
analyzed: byams ma'i bu gang pos smras pa /
translated: Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra said,

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, how is a bodhisattva a Dharma teacher?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,
