analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par byed pa de ni gnyis so //
translated: To create afflictions and to create freedom from afflictions is two.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The nature of afflictions is nondual.

original: bdag dang / bdag med par byed pa de ni gnyis so //
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag med par byed pa de ni gnyis so //
translated: The self and the selflessness that is imposed upon it are dualistic.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The nature of the self is nondual.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The Devaputra said:

original: 'jam dpal / bdag gis rang bzhin gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / bdag gis rang bzhin gang yin /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what is the nature of the self?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: lha'i bu / bdag gi rang bzhin ni bzod ma nas dag pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / bdag gi rang bzhin ni bzod ma nas dag pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Devaputra, the nature of the self is selflessness, because it is pure from the beginning.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin ni bzod ma nas dag pa'i phyir gzod ma nas dben pa nyid dang / gzod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid dang / gzod ma nas ma byung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin ni bzod ma nas dag pa'i phyir gzod ma nas dben pa nyid dang / gzod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid dang / gzod ma nas ma byung ba nyid yin no //
translated: The nature of the self is primordially void, primordially unborn, and primordially nonarising, because it is pure from the beginning.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The Devaputra said:

original: 'jam dpal / ci'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ci'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya /
translated: Mañjuśrī, why is it called “nature”?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: @190b lha'i bu /🔽de ni 'gyur ba med pas de'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @190b lha'i bu / de ni 'gyur ba med pas de'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: Devaputra,🔽it is called “nature” because it is unchanging.

original: de ni gzod ma nyid nas gsal zhing nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas de'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzod ma nyid nas gsal zhing nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas de'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “nature” because it is clear from the beginning and is not defiled.

original: de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam zhing tshad med pas de'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam zhing tshad med pas de'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: It is equal to space, and because it is immeasurable, it is called the nature.

original: de ni spros pa dang bral ba dang / de ni rgyu ba dang bral ba dang / de ni 'od gsal bas de'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni spros pa dang bral ba dang / de ni rgyu ba dang bral ba dang / de ni 'od gsal bas de'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: It is free from conceptual elaboration, free from movement, and luminous, and therefore it is called the nature.

original: de ni blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pas de phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //🔽lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: de ni blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pas de phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o // lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: It is free from acceptance and rejection, and therefore it is called the nature.

original: 'jam dpal / rang bzhin mi shes pa dag gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rang bzhin mi shes pa dag gang yin /
translated: The god said, “Mañjuśrī, who are those who do not know the nature?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / gang dag chos rnams kyi rang bzhin mi shes pa dag go /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang dag chos rnams kyi rang bzhin mi shes pa dag go /
translated: “Divine son, those who do not know the nature of phenomena.”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / rang bzhin shes pa dag gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rang bzhin shes pa dag gang yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, who are those who know the nature?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / gang dag de dag gi rang bzhin shes pa dag go /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang dag de dag gi rang bzhin shes pa dag go /
translated: “Divine son, those who know that nature.”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / dad pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dad pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, what are the characteristics of those who have faith?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,🔽“Divine son, those who have faith are those who have faith in the Tathāgata’s teaching of the nature of phenomena.”🔽The god said,🔽“Mañjuśrī, what is the nature of phenomena?”

original: lha'i bu / dad pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / dad pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa yin no //
translated: Divine son, the characteristic of having faith is to be completely beyond all attachment.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / dge slong dad pa dang mi ldan pa ji ltar dad pas byin pa la dad par byed /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge slong dad pa dang mi ldan pa ji ltar dad pas byin pa la dad par byed /
translated: Mañjuśrī, how do faithless monks have faith in the offerings of the faithful?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /🔽lha'i bu / dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang mngon sum du gyur pa'i chos @191a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa / lha'i bu / dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang mngon sum du gyur pa'i chos @191a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: thams cad la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing gzhan gyi dad pas yang dang yang du mi 'gro ba yin pas de'i phyir dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing gzhan gyi dad pas yang dang yang du mi 'gro ba yin pas de'i phyir dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Divine son, those who are called faithless are those who do not rely on others with regard to all phenomena that are directly perceptible. They do not go again and again to others for faith. Therefore, they are called faithless.

original: de ni dad pas byin pa spyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ni dad pas byin pa spyod par mi byed do //
translated: They do not make use of the offerings of the faithful.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzod ma nas dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzod ma nas dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are pure from the beginning.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / dge slong gang dge 'dun dang lhan cig mi gnas pa de la ji skad ces bya /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge slong gang dge 'dun dang lhan cig mi gnas pa de la ji skad ces bya /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what is a monk called who does not live together with the saṅgha?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / dge slong gang dge 'dun dang lhan cig mi gnas pa de ni des na 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i bu / dge slong gang dge 'dun dang lhan cig mi gnas pa de ni des na 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Divine son, the monk who does not dwell together with the saṅgha becomes a recipient of the world’s offerings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i bu / dge 'dun ni 'dus ma byas pa yin la /
analyzed: lha'i bu / dge 'dun ni 'dus ma byas pa yin la /
translated: Divine son, the saṅgha is unconditioned.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dus ma byas dang lhan cig mi gnas pas de'i phyir de ni 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas su 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dus ma byas dang lhan cig mi gnas pas de'i phyir de ni 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas su 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not dwell together with the unconditioned, they become recipients of the world’s offerings.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'dus ma byas dang lhan cig gnas par gyur na nyes pa cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'dus ma byas dang lhan cig gnas par gyur na nyes pa cir 'gyur /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, if bodhisattvas were to dwell together with the unconditioned, what would be the problem?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / 'dus ma byas thob nas sems can rnams skyob par mi byed cing nyan thos su 'gyur bas de'i nyes pa ni der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'dus ma byas thob nas sems can rnams skyob par mi byed cing nyan thos su 'gyur bas de'i nyes pa ni der 'gyur ro //
translated: “Divine son, the problem would be that, having attained the unconditioned, they would not protect sentient beings and would become śrāvakas.”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / 'dus byas ni so so skye bo'i sa yin la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'dus byas ni so so skye bo'i sa yin la /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, conditioned phenomena are the level of ordinary beings,

original: 'dus ma byas ni 'phags pa rnams kyis yin na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni 'phags pa rnams kyis yin na /
translated: The unconditioned is for the noble ones.

original: 'o na / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i sa spangs shing so so skye bo'i sa la @191b gnas pa 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas su 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i sa spangs shing so so skye bo'i sa la @191b gnas pa 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas su 'gyur /
translated: But how is it that the bodhisattva, having abandoned the stage of the noble ones, abides in the stage of ordinary beings and becomes a field of merit for the world?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' 'dus byas la'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' 'dus byas la'ang mi gnas /
translated: Divine son, the bodhisattva does not abide in the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas la'ang mi gnas pas de'i phyir de ni 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la'ang mi gnas pas de'i phyir de ni 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: nor does he abide in the unconditioned. For that reason, he becomes a field of merit for the world.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' ni 'du byed las yid bskyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas la mi gnas pa yin pas 'dus byas kyi skyon dang bral ba dang / 'dus mas byas shes pa rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' ni 'du byed las yid bskyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas la mi gnas pa yin pas 'dus byas kyi skyon dang bral ba dang / 'dus mas byas shes pa rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Divine son, the bodhisattva is unmoved by conditioned things and does not abide in the unconditioned. Thus, he is free from the faults of the conditioned and realizes the unconditioned.

original: de 'dus byas kyi skyon dang bral bas ni 'dus byas la mi gnas la /
analyzed: de 'dus byas kyi skyon dang bral bas ni 'dus byas la mi gnas la /
translated: Since he is free from the faults of the conditioned, he does not abide in the conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas shes pa rtogs pas ni 'dus ma byas su mi ltung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas shes pa rtogs pas ni 'dus ma byas su mi ltung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since he realizes the unconditioned, he does not fall into the unconditioned.

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: Divine son, it is like this.

original: dper na / tshan po che chen pos steng gi bar snang la mda' 'phangs par gyur la de nas mda' de nam mkha' la mi gnas par 'dug cing sa la'ang mi ltung na /
analyzed: dper na / tshan po che chen pos steng gi bar snang la mda' 'phangs par gyur la de nas mda' de nam mkha' la mi gnas par 'dug cing sa la'ang mi ltung na /
translated: For example, a great champion might shoot an arrow into the sky, and it would remain there without falling to the ground.

original: lha'i bu / de la dka' ba cung zad yod dam /
analyzed: lha'i bu / de la dka' ba cung zad yod dam /
translated: Divine son, would that be difficult?

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god replied,

original: 'jam dpal / dka'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dka'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, it would be difficult.”🔽Mañjuśrī said,

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa; ;lha'i bu /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa; ;lha'i bu /
translated: “Divine son,

original: de bas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag 'dus byas kyang mi spong zhing 'dus ma byas kyang thob par byed la /
analyzed: de bas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag 'dus byas kyang mi spong zhing 'dus ma byas kyang thob par byed la /
translated: it is even more difficult for bodhisattva great beings not to reject the conditioned, to attain the unconditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas su'ang mi ltung zhing 'dus byas thob pa rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed pa ni ches dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas su'ang mi ltung zhing 'dus byas thob pa rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed pa ni ches dka' ba yin no //
translated: not to fall into the unconditioned, and to bring to maturity those who have attained the conditioned.”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa'i 'jigs pa 'dus byas @192a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa'i 'jigs pa 'dus byas @192a *//
translated: “Mañjuśrī, are the fears of bodhisattvas conditioned

original: sam; 'on te 'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: sam; 'on te 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: or unconditioned?

original: gang las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: From what do they arise?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,🔽“Divine son, the fears of bodhisattvas are conditioned.

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa'i 'jigs pa ni 'dus byas las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa'i 'jigs pa ni 'dus byas las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Devaputra, the bodhisattva’s fears arise from conditioned things.

original: 'dus ma byas las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Devaputra, the bodhisattva’s fears arise from the conditioned and also arise from the unconditioned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lha'i bu / 'dus byas las ni nyon mongs pa'i 'jigs pa 'byung la /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'dus byas las ni nyon mongs pa'i 'jigs pa 'byung la /
translated: Devaputra, from the conditioned arises the fear of afflictions,

analyzed: 'dus ma byas las ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and from the unconditioned arises the fear of being without afflictions.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The Devaputra said,🔽“Mañjuśrī, what is the fear of being without afflictions?”

original: 'jam dpal / nyon mongs pa med pas 'jigs pa ci yod 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / nyon mongs pa med pas 'jigs pa ci yod 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

analyzed: lha'i bu / khams gsum na ni nyon mongs pa'i 'jigs pa yod la /
translated: “Devaputra, in the three realms there is the fear of afflictions,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang khams gsum du nyon mongs par mi byed na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang khams gsum du nyon mongs par mi byed na /
translated: but if a bodhisattva does not afflict the three realms,

original: de ni nyan thos su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos su 'gyur ro //
translated: he will become a śrāvaka.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The Devaputra said,

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, how is a bodhisattva fearless?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,🔽“Devaputra, a bodhisattva is fearless when he does not see any dharma that is afflicted and does not see any dharma that is purified.

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi shes pas 'dus byas la spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi shes pas 'dus byas la spyod par byed cing /
translated: “Divine son, when bodhisattvas engage with conditioned phenomena through the knowledge of insight,

original: thabs kyi shes pas 'dus ma byas su mi ltung ba de lta na /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas 'dus ma byas su mi ltung ba de lta na /
translated: and through the knowledge of means do not fall into the unconditioned,

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa'i 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa'i 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: then, divine son, the bodhisattvas are fearless.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: “Divine son, moreover,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems can la lta bas 'dus byas spong bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems can la lta bas 'dus byas spong bar mi byed cing /
translated: when bodhisattvas, out of concern for sentient beings, do not abandon conditioned phenomena,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos @192b la lta bas 'dus ma byas su mi ltung ba de lta na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos @192b la lta bas 'dus ma byas su mi ltung ba de lta na /
translated: and, out of concern for the qualities of the buddhas, do not fall into the unconditioned,

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: then, divine son, the bodhisattvas are fearless.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: “Divine son, moreover,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi tshogs nye bar bsags pa'i phyir 'dus byas la sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi tshogs nye bar bsags pa'i phyir 'dus byas la sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: when bodhisattvas, in order to accumulate the provisions of merit, engage with conditioned phenomena,🔽and, in order to accumulate the provisions of wisdom, do not abandon the unconditioned,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi tshogs nye bar bsags pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas su mi ltung ba de lta na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi tshogs nye bar bsags pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas su mi ltung ba de lta na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Because he does not fall into the uncompounded, because he has accumulated the equipment of the intuition of a Buddha, the Bodhisattva is fearless.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, son of the gods,

analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' 'dus ma byas la gnas te bsam gtan rnams skyed par byed cing /
translated: when the Bodhisattva, dwelling in the uncompounded, generates the meditative concentrations,

analyzed: thabs la gnas te bsam gtan rnams las ldog par byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: and, dwelling in the means, turns away from the meditative concentrations, then the Bodhisattva is fearless.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, son of the gods,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la gnas te dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar gsog par byed cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la gnas te dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar gsog par byed cing /
translated: when the Bodhisattva, dwelling in the thought of enlightenment, accumulates the roots of virtue,

original: snying rje chen po la gnas te sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rje chen po la gnas te sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: and, dwelling in great compassion, brings beings to maturity, then the Bodhisattva is fearless.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, son of the gods,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' dben pa la gnas te bdud kyi las rnams rtogs par byed cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' dben pa la gnas te bdud kyi las rnams rtogs par byed cing /
translated: When the bodhisattva abides in solitude and recognizes the works of Māra,

original: thabs la gnas te bdud gyi las rnams spong bar byed pa de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs la gnas te bdud gyi las rnams spong bar byed pa de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: and when, abiding in the means, he abandons the works of Māra, then the bodhisattva is fearless.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, son of a god,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' byams pa chen po @193a *//
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' byams pa chen po @193a *//
translated: when the bodhisattva, abiding in great love,

original: la gnas te chos ston par byed cing /
analyzed: la gnas te chos ston par byed cing /
translated: teaches the Dharma,

original: snying rje chen po la gnas te zang zing gi sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rje chen po la gnas te zang zing gi sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: and abiding in great compassion, gives material gifts, then the bodhisattva is fearless.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, son of a god,🔽when the bodhisattva, abiding in saṃsāra, performs the deeds that are conducive to nirvāṇa,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba la gnas te mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su spyad pa'i las byed cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba la gnas te mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su spyad pa'i las byed cing /
translated: and

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas te 'khor ba yongs su spyad pa'i las byed pa de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas te 'khor ba yongs su spyad pa'i las byed pa de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is fearless when, abiding in nirvāṇa, he performs the actions of completely enjoying saṃsāra.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, divine son,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' skye ba med pas skye bar byed cing 'pho ba med pas 'byung bar byed pa dang / chos la lta bas snang bar byed cing phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' skye ba med pas skye bar byed cing 'pho ba med pas 'byung bar byed pa dang / chos la lta bas snang bar byed cing phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: when the bodhisattva, through non-arising, causes arising and through non-transference, causes transference, and through the view of phenomena, causes illumination, and is not distinguished by the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields,

original: thams cad dang rjes su 'brel zhing zhi ba dang nye bar zhi bar gyur ba dang / 'bar bar byed cing 'bar bas tshig par mi byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad la yongs su spyod par byed cing nyon mongs pa'i skyon rnams kyis mi gos pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad dang rjes su 'brel zhing zhi ba dang nye bar zhi bar gyur ba dang / 'bar bar byed cing 'bar bas tshig par mi byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad la yongs su spyod par byed cing nyon mongs pa'i skyon rnams kyis mi gos pa dang /
translated: when he is connected with everything and has become peaceful and completely pacified, and when he causes blazing and does not burn through blazing, and when he causes the enjoyment of all afflictions and is not tainted by the faults of the afflictions,

original: slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams 'dul bar byed cing nyan thos kyi rnam par grol ba la reg par mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa la 'jug cing chos kyi bsam pa spong bar mi byed pa dang / bdud kyi lcags kyu shes par byed cing chos kyi lcags kyu spong bar @193b mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams 'dul bar byed cing nyan thos kyi rnam par grol ba la reg par mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa la 'jug cing chos kyi bsam pa spong bar mi byed pa dang / bdud kyi lcags kyu shes par byed cing chos kyi lcags kyu spong bar @193b mi byed pa dang /
translated: They train those in training and those beyond training, but they do not touch the liberation of the śrāvakas. They engage with the thoughts of sentient beings, but they do not abandon the thought of Dharma. They know the hooks of Māra, but they do not abandon the hooks of Dharma.

original: shes pas 'jug par byed cing thabs kyis ldog par byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i rnam pa ston par byed cing 'phags pa ma yin pa yongs su smin par bya ba la spro bar byed pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba la mngon par dga' bar byed cing chos mthong ba la kun tu 'dod par byed pa de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pas 'jug par byed cing thabs kyis ldog par byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i rnam pa ston par byed cing 'phags pa ma yin pa yongs su smin par bya ba la spro bar byed pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba la mngon par dga' bar byed cing chos mthong ba la kun tu 'dod par byed pa de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: They engage with knowledge, but they turn away with skillful means. They manifest the aspects of the noble ones, but they are enthusiastic about bringing the non-noble ones to maturity. They delight in seeing the Buddha, but they are intent on seeing the Dharma. To that extent, bodhisattvas are fearless.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa 'di bshad pa na lha'i bu lnga khri chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa 'di bshad pa na lha'i bu lnga khri chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: When Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta had expounded this teaching, fifty thousand gods purified the eye of Dharma with regard to phenomena, free from dust and uncontaminated.

original: lha'i bu nyi khri lnga stong ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems can rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: lha'i bu nyi khri lnga stong ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems can rnam par grol lo //
translated: Twenty-five thousand gods were liberated from defilements without grasping.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lnga khri ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lnga khri ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob par gyur to //
translated: Fifty thousand bodhisattvas who had previously planted roots of virtue attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyi khri ni spobs pa thogs pa med pa skyes so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyi khri ni spobs pa thogs pa med pa skyes so /
translated: Twenty thousand bodhisattvas attained unimpeded eloquence.

original: lha dang / mi rnams kyi skye dgu las srog chags stong phrag rab tu mang po dag gis ni byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: lha dang / mi rnams kyi skye dgu las srog chags stong phrag rab tu mang po dag gis ni byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: Many thousands of living beings from the human and divine worlds generated the mind directed toward supreme and perfect awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la lha'i mchod pa dag byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la lha'i mchod pa dag byas so //
translated: They made divine offerings to the Tathāgata and to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: gzhan yang / lha'i bu rab rtsal sems kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / lha'i bu rab rtsal sems kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Furthermore, the divine son Suviśuddhamati said this to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, how do bodhisattvas abide in the path?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /🔽lha'i bu / gang gi @194a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa / lha'i bu / gang gi @194a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: tshe byang chub sems dpa' 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir yang chos ston par byed la 'dod chags dang bral ba mngon du'ang mi byed pa dang / zhe sdang spangs pa'i phyir yang chos ston par byed la zhe sdang spong ba mngon du mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: tshe byang chub sems dpa' 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir yang chos ston par byed la 'dod chags dang bral ba mngon du'ang mi byed pa dang / zhe sdang spangs pa'i phyir yang chos ston par byed la zhe sdang spong ba mngon du mi byed pa dang /
translated: “Divine son, when bodhisattvas teach the Dharma in order to abandon attachment but do not manifest freedom from attachment, and teach the Dharma in order to abandon anger but do not manifest the abandonment of anger,

original: gti mug spang pa'i phyir yang chos ston par byed la gti mug spong ba mngon du'ang mi byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir chos ston par yang byed la nyon mongs pa spong ba mngon du'ang mi byed pa de tsam gyis na /
analyzed: gti mug spang pa'i phyir yang chos ston par byed la gti mug spong ba mngon du'ang mi byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir chos ston par yang byed la nyon mongs pa spong ba mngon du'ang mi byed pa de tsam gyis na /
translated: and teach the Dharma in order to abandon delusion but do not manifest the abandonment of delusion, and teach the Dharma in order to abandon afflictions but do not manifest the abandonment of afflictions,

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Devaputra, the bodhisattva is established in the path.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, Devaputra,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la stong pa nyid ston par yang byed la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la stong pa nyid ston par yang byed la /
translated: when the bodhisattva teaches emptiness to sentient beings,🔽but does not actualize emptiness,🔽when he teaches the signless to sentient beings, but does not actualize the signless,

original: stong pa nyid mngon du'ang mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams la mtshan ma med pa stong par yang byed la mtshan ma med pa mngon du'ang mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams la smon pa med pa ston par yang byed la smon pa med pa mngon du'ang mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mngon du'ang mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams la mtshan ma med pa stong par yang byed la mtshan ma med pa mngon du'ang mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams la smon pa med pa ston par yang byed la smon pa med pa mngon du'ang mi byed pa dang /
translated: when he teaches the wishless to sentient beings, but does not actualize the wishless,

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mi ldan pa dang / 'gog pa'i chos ston par yang byed la 'gog pa mngon du'ang mi byed pa de tsam gyis na @194b byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mi ldan pa dang / 'gog pa'i chos ston par yang byed la 'gog pa mngon du'ang mi byed pa de tsam gyis na @194b byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, he teaches sentient beings the Dharma of non-production, non-arising, non-occurrence, non-entity, freedom from desire, non-possession, and cessation, but does not actualize cessation.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Divine Prince, furthermore,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' yongs su mi gtong bas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa dang / tshul khrims las yang dag par 'da' bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa dang / gnod sems kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' yongs su mi gtong bas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa dang / tshul khrims las yang dag par 'da' bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa dang / gnod sems kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa dang /
translated: when a bodhisattva practices the perfection of generosity by not giving up, practices the perfection of moral discipline by not transgressing moral discipline, practices the perfection of patience by not being angry, practices the perfection of perseverance by not being lazy, practices the perfection of concentration by not being distracted, and practices the perfection of wisdom by not being ignorant, that is the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: le los brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa dang / brjed ngas pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa dang / bems pe dang / lug ltar lkugs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: le los brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa dang / brjed ngas pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa dang / bems pe dang / lug ltar lkugs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
translated: “The bodhisattva who practices the perfection of generosity by giving away all his possessions, who practices the perfection of morality by not harming even at the cost of his life, who practices the perfection of patience by not becoming angry even when his limbs are cut off, who practices the perfection of effort by being diligent in the practice of the perfections, who practices the perfection of concentration by being undistracted in the practice of the perfections, and who practices the perfection of wisdom by not being confused about the practice of the perfections—that bodhisattva is said to be practicing the perfections.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /🔽'jam dpal / ci las bsams te de skad smra /🔽'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa / 'jam dpal / ci las bsams te de skad smra / 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: “The bodhisattva who practices the perfection of generosity by giving away all his possessions, who practices the perfection of morality by not harming even at the cost of his life, who practices the perfection of patience by not becoming angry even when his limbs are cut off, who practices the perfection of effort by being diligent in the practice of the perfections, who practices the perfection of concentration by being undistracted in the practice of the perfections, and who practices the perfection of wisdom by not being confused about the practice of the perfections—that bodhisattva is said to be practicing the perfections.

original: lha'i bu / bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su mi gtong ba yin te /🔽bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: lha'i bu / bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su mi gtong ba yin te / bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “The bodhisattva who practices the perfection of generosity by giving away all his possessions, who practices the perfection of morality by not harming even at the cost of his life, who practices the perfection of patience by not becoming angry even when his limbs are cut off, who practices the perfection of effort by being diligent in the practice of the perfections, who practices the perfection of concentration by being undistracted in the practice of the perfections, and who practices the perfection of wisdom by not being confused about the practice of the perfections—that bodhisattva is said to be practicing the perfections.🔽“The bodhisattva who practices the perfection of generosity by giving away all his possessions, who practices the perfection of morality by not harming even at the cost of his life, who practices the perfection of patience by not becoming angry even when his limbs are cut off, who practices the perfection of effort by being diligent in the practice of the perfections, who practices the perfection of concentration by being undistracted in the practice of the perfections, and who practices the perfection of wisdom by not being confused about the practice of the perfections—that bodhisattva is said to be practicing the perfections.

original: sems can yongs su mi gtong ba dang / chos yongs su mi gtong ba dang / byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su mi gtong ba dang / chos yongs su mi gtong ba dang / byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba ste /
translated: “The bodhisattva who practices the perfection of generosity by giving away all his possessions, who practices the perfection of morality by not harming even at the cost of his

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos bzhi po de dag yongs su mi gtong bas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed do //🔽lha'i bu / tshul khrims las yang @195a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos bzhi po de dag yongs su mi gtong bas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed do // lha'i bu / tshul khrims las yang @195a *//
translated: The bodhisattva, not abandoning these four dharmas, accomplishes the perfection of generosity.

original: dag par 'da' ba zhes bya ba de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i tshig bla dvags te /
analyzed: dag par 'da' ba zhes bya ba de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i tshig bla dvags te /
translated: “Son of gods, ‘to transgress morality’ is a term for its non-nature.

original: tshul khrims las yang dag par 'da' bas ting nge 'dzin dang ting nge 'dzin las yang dag par 'da' bas shes rab dang / shes rab las yang dag par 'da' bas rnam par grol ba shes pa sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: tshul khrims las yang dag par 'da' bas ting nge 'dzin dang ting nge 'dzin las yang dag par 'da' bas shes rab dang / shes rab las yang dag par 'da' bas rnam par grol ba shes pa sgrub par byed de /
translated: By transgressing morality, he accomplishes the concentration that is the non-nature of concentration; by transgressing concentration, he accomplishes the wisdom that is the non-nature of wisdom; and by transgressing wisdom, he accomplishes the knowledge of liberation that is the non-nature of liberation.

original: lha'i bu / khyod kyis rnam grangs des gang tshul khrims las yang dag par 'da' ba de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / khyod kyis rnam grangs des gang tshul khrims las yang dag par 'da' ba de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Son of gods, by this formulation you should understand that whoever transgresses morality accomplishes the perfection of morality.”

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' gang gnod sems la zhugs pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa las log par zhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las log par zhugs pa yin pas de ni theg pa chen po la legs par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' gang gnod sems la zhugs pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa las log par zhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las log par zhugs pa yin pas de ni theg pa chen po la legs par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Devaputra, if a bodhisattva were to engage in malice, he would be engaging in the wrong approach for the vehicle of the hearers and the wrong approach for the vehicle of the solitary buddhas. Therefore, he would be engaging in the right approach for the Great Vehicle.

original: gang theg pa chen po la legs par zhugs pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang theg pa chen po la legs par zhugs pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Whoever engages in the right approach for the Great Vehicle accomplishes the perfection of patience.

original: lha'i bu; gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi rtul bar mi byed cing ngag dang sems kyi bu rtul bar mi byed pa de ni le lo can yin la /
analyzed: lha'i bu; gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi rtul bar mi byed cing ngag dang sems kyi bu rtul bar mi byed pa de ni le lo can yin la /
translated: Devaputra, when a bodhisattva does not exert himself physically, verbally, or mentally, he is lazy.

original: gang de ltar chos la mngon par brtson pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang de ltar chos la mngon par brtson pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Whoever exerts himself in this way with regard to the Dharma accomplishes the perfection of diligence.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Devaputra, moreover,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rmi lam na'ang sa gnyis po dag la dga' @195b pa'i sems skyed par mi byed pas de ni brjed ngas pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rmi lam na'ang sa gnyis po dag la dga' @195b pa'i sems skyed par mi byed pas de ni brjed ngas pa yin la /
translated: That is his forgetfulness.🔽Whatever is forgetfulness in the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is meditative equipoise in the Great Vehicle.

original: gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la brjed ngas pa de ni theg pa chen po la mnyam par bzhag pa yin pas de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la brjed ngas pa de ni theg pa chen po la mnyam par bzhag pa yin pas de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he accomplishes the perfection of meditative stability.

original: lha'i bu chos thams cad ni bems po ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu chos thams cad ni bems po ste /
translated: Son of a god, all phenomena are inanimate.

original: rtsva dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / lam dang / mig yor dang / lug ltar lkugs pa dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gyis nus pa med pa yin pas /
analyzed: rtsva dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / lam dang / mig yor dang / lug ltar lkugs pa dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gyis nus pa med pa yin pas /
translated: Like grass, trees, walls, paths, optical illusions, and dumb sheep, they are by nature powerless.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' shes rab dang ye shes kyis de ltar chos thams cad bems po dang / lug ltar lkugs pa lta bus byang chub sgrub par byed pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' shes rab dang ye shes kyis de ltar chos thams cad bems po dang / lug ltar lkugs pa lta bus byang chub sgrub par byed pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: When the Bodhisattva, through wisdom and knowledge, thus accomplishes enlightenment with all things that are like a block of wood or a dumb sheep, then he accomplishes the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lam sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lam sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The Bodhisattva who has thus entered accomplishes the path.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, son of a god,

original: gang gi tsha byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i lam yang mi spong la /
analyzed: gang gi tsha byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i lam yang mi spong la /
translated: when the Bodhisattva does not abandon the path of cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yang tshol bar byed pa dang / lam gyi las kyi rgyun yang mi gcod cing lam gyi byang ba'ang sgrub par byed pa dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyang lam la 'god par byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yang tshol bar byed pa dang / lam gyi las kyi rgyun yang mi gcod cing lam gyi byang ba'ang sgrub par byed pa dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyang lam la 'god par byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
translated: but seeks the path of nirvana, and does not cut off the continuity of the path's activity, but accomplishes the path's purification, and establishes beings who have entered bad paths on the path, in this way the Bodhisattva abides in the path.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, son of a god,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad dang chos thams cad btsal yang mi rnyed pa dang / byang chub kyi @196a *//
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad dang chos thams cad btsal yang mi rnyed pa dang / byang chub kyi @196a *//
translated: When a bodhisattva does not find any sentient beings or any phenomena, and yet does not abandon the path to awakening,

original: lam spong bar mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu yod pa bsam gtan byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi lam thob pa yin no //
analyzed: lam spong bar mi byed pa dang / 'bras bu yod pa bsam gtan byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi lam thob pa yin no //
translated: and when he or she practices concentration with a view to the existence of results, then the bodhisattva has attained the path to awakening.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: “Moreover, son of a god,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi lam yang rab tu shes la nyan thos kyi lam gyis nges par 'byung bar yang mi byed pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yang rab tu shes la rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis nges par 'byung bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi lam yang rab tu shes la nyan thos kyi lam gyis nges par 'byung bar yang mi byed pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yang rab tu shes la rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis nges par 'byung bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: when a bodhisattva knows the path of the hearers but does not attain liberation through the path of the hearers, and when he or she knows the path of the solitary buddhas but does not attain liberation through the path of the solitary buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yang thob par byed la lam des kyang dbang po yongs su ma rdzogs par nges par 'byung bar mi byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yang thob par byed la lam des kyang dbang po yongs su ma rdzogs par nges par 'byung bar mi byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
translated: He also attains the bodhisattva path, and by that path he does not attain liberation without perfecting the faculties. In this way, the bodhisattva is established in the path.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, son of a god,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba'i 'bras bu don du mi gnyer ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa'i skyon gyis mi gos pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba'i 'bras bu don du mi gnyer ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa'i skyon gyis mi gos pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed pa dang /
translated: when the bodhisattva does not strive for the result of the formation of all roots of virtue, is not tainted by the faults of formation, and dedicates all the formations of roots of virtue to awakening,

original: byang chub kyi phyir 'phel ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang / 'bri ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de lta na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir 'phel ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang / 'bri ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de lta na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
translated: and when he does not see increase for the sake of awakening, and does not see decrease, in this way the bodhisattva is established in the path.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, son of a god,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' lam ngan pa las lam yongs @196b su tshol bar byed pa dang / lam yongs su btsal nas kyang nges par 'byung bar mi byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' lam ngan pa las lam yongs @196b su tshol bar byed pa dang / lam yongs su btsal nas kyang nges par 'byung bar mi byed pa de lta na byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas pa yin no //
translated: When the bodhisattva seeks the path from the wrong path, and having sought the path, does not cause liberation, then the bodhisattva is established in the path.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The Devaputra said:

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lam ngan pa las lam yongs su tshol bar byed /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lam ngan pa las lam yongs su tshol bar byed /
translated: Mañjuśrī, how does the bodhisattva seek the path from the wrong path?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu lam ngan pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu lam ngan pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: Devaputra, the wrong path is called saṃsāra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de la gnas nas sems can nges par 'byung ba'i phyir lam yongs su tshol bar byed kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de la gnas nas sems can nges par 'byung ba'i phyir lam yongs su tshol bar byed kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva, dwelling there, seeks the path in order to liberate sentient beings.

original: bdag nyid nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: But not in order to liberate himself.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The Devaputra said:

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva’s conduct is contrary to that of the entire world.

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jig rten na spyod kyang 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi gos pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa ston par byed kyang nyon mongs pa med pa nyid du mi ltung ba dang / rga ba dang /🔽'chi ba ston par byed kyang chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med par shes shing skyon med pa mngon du mi byed pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la yongs su spyod pa byed kyang phung po dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jig rten na spyod kyang 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi gos pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa ston par byed kyang nyon mongs pa med pa nyid du mi ltung ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba ston par byed kyang chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med par shes shing skyon med pa mngon du mi byed pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la yongs su spyod pa byed kyang phung po dang /
translated: Divine son, it is like this: bodhisattvas engage in worldly activity, yet they are unstained by worldly phenomena. They demonstrate the absence of afflictions, yet they do not fall into the absence of afflictions. They demonstrate aging and death, yet they understand that all phenomena are unborn and non-arising, and they do not actualize the absence of faults. They engage in the aggregates, elements, and sense sources, yet they do not pursue the aggregates, elements, and sense sources.

original: khams dang / skye mched don du mi gnyer ba dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams la @197a *//
analyzed: khams dang / skye mched don du mi gnyer ba dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams la @197a *//
translated: For the sake of understanding the aggregates, elements, and sense sources, they teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: chos ston kyang yongs su shes pa de dag yongs su shes par mi byed pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par sgrub par byed cing sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams nye bar 'jog par byed kyang nye bar 'jog pa la 'byung bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: chos ston kyang yongs su shes pa de dag yongs su shes par mi byed pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par sgrub par byed cing sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams nye bar 'jog par byed kyang nye bar 'jog pa la 'byung bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: They practice concentration, liberation, absorption, and attainment, and they establish those whose minds are distracted, but they do not cause them to attain stability.

original: bdud kyi yul nye bar ston par byed kyang bdud kyi las rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul spong bar mi byed pa dang / bdud kyi yul gyi rjes su mi 'jug pa dang; chos kyi dbyings kyi yul las ldog par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdud kyi yul nye bar ston par byed kyang bdud kyi las rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul spong bar mi byed pa dang / bdud kyi yul gyi rjes su mi 'jug pa dang; chos kyi dbyings kyi yul las ldog par mi byed pa dang /
translated: They demonstrate the domain of Māra without being affected by the activities of Māra. They do not abandon the domain of the buddhas, and they do not follow the domain of Māra. They do not turn away from the domain of the realm of phenomena.

original: sems can gyi khams kyi yul nye bar len par byed pas na de'i phyir sems can chen po de dag gi spyod pa ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi yul nye bar len par byed pas na de'i phyir sems can chen po de dag gi spyod pa ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: They take up the domain of the realm of sentient beings. Therefore, the conduct of those great beings is not in accord with the entire world.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The Devaputra said:

original: 'jam dpal / khyod byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa la spobs par gyis shig /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa la spobs par gyis shig /
translated: Manjusri, you should be confident in the Bodhisattvas' conduct.

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Manjusri said:

original: lha'i bu / bsam pa yongs su dag cing nang dang / phyi rol dben pa nyid kyis lhag pa'i bsam pa la spyod pa dang / rab tu spyod pa med pa nyid kyis sbyor ba la spyod pa dang / sems mi brjed pa nyid kyis byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / bsam pa yongs su dag cing nang dang / phyi rol dben pa nyid kyis lhag pa'i bsam pa la spyod pa dang / rab tu spyod pa med pa nyid kyis sbyor ba la spyod pa dang / sems mi brjed pa nyid kyis byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: Devaputra, by the purity of intention and the inner and outer emptiness, one practices the superior intention. By the absence of activity, one practices the application. By the non-forgetfulness of mind, one practices the non-forgetfulness of the thought of enlightenment.

original: sems dul ba nyid kyis sbyin pa la spyod pa dang / sems zhi ba nyid kyis @197b tshul khrims la spyod pa dang / rmas pa med pa nyid kyis bzod pa la spyod pa dang / lus dben pa nyid kyis brtson 'grus la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sems dul ba nyid kyis sbyin pa la spyod pa dang / sems zhi ba nyid kyis @197b tshul khrims la spyod pa dang / rmas pa med pa nyid kyis bzod pa la spyod pa dang / lus dben pa nyid kyis brtson 'grus la spyod pa dang /
translated: By the subduing of mind, one practices generosity. By the pacification of mind, one practices morality. By the absence of injury, one practices patience. By the solitude of body, one practices effort.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par g-yeng ba med pa nyid kyis bsam gtan la spyod pa dang / spros pa med pa nyid kyis shes rab la spyod pa dang / sems can la bdag med pa nyid kyis byams pa la spyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa yod pa ma yin par rab tu zhi ba nyid kyis snying rje la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par g-yeng ba med pa nyid kyis bsam gtan la spyod pa dang / spros pa med pa nyid kyis shes rab la spyod pa dang / sems can la bdag med pa nyid kyis byams pa la spyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa yod pa ma yin par rab tu zhi ba nyid kyis snying rje la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice concentration by being undistracted from the basic space of phenomena, they practice wisdom by being free of conceptual elaboration, they practice loving kindness by being free of the self in sentient beings, they practice compassion by being utterly peaceful in the absence of afflictive emotions,

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba'i phyir dga' ba la spyod pa dang / mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir btang snyoms la spyod pa dang / gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir mi rtag pa la so sor rtog pa la spyod pa dang / yongs su rtog pa sdug bsngal ba'i phyir sdug bsngal la so sor rtog pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba'i phyir dga' ba la spyod pa dang / mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir btang snyoms la spyod pa dang / gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir mi rtag pa la so sor rtog pa la spyod pa dang / yongs su rtog pa sdug bsngal ba'i phyir sdug bsngal la so sor rtog pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: they practice joy by being naturally liberated, they practice impartiality by being free of the two extremes, they practice discernment of impermanence by being primordially unborn, they practice discernment of suffering by being fully conceptualized,

original: phyin ci log rang bzhin med pa'i phyir bdag med pa la so sor rtog pa la spyod pa dang / 'du shes yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhi ba la so sor rtog pa la spyad pa dang / phung po sgyu ma lta bur yongs su shes pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: phyin ci log rang bzhin med pa'i phyir bdag med pa la so sor rtog pa la spyod pa dang / 'du shes yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhi ba la so sor rtog pa la spyad pa dang / phung po sgyu ma lta bur yongs su shes pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice discerning the selflessness of the person because of the absence of intrinsic existence of the distorted. They practice discerning peace because of thoroughly knowing discernment. They practice discerning the thorough knowledge of suffering because of thoroughly knowing the aggregates to be like illusions.

original: ma rig pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir kun 'byung ba shes pa la spyod pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'gag pa'i phyir 'gog pa shes pa la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir lam shes pa la spyod @198a *//
analyzed: ma rig pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir kun 'byung ba shes pa la spyod pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'gag pa'i phyir 'gog pa shes pa la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir lam shes pa la spyod @198a *//
translated: They practice discerning the thorough knowledge of the all-pervading origin because of ignorance preceding. They practice discerning the thorough knowledge of cessation because of cessation by nature. They practice discerning the thorough knowledge of the path because of not fixating on the conditioned.

original: pa dang / 'bras bu yongs su shes pa nyid kyis rgyu shes pa la spyod pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir rkyen shes pa la spyod pa dang; du ma'i phyir tshogs pa la spyod pa dang / brjod du med pa'i phyir don so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: pa dang / 'bras bu yongs su shes pa nyid kyis rgyu shes pa la spyod pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir rkyen shes pa la spyod pa dang; du ma'i phyir tshogs pa la spyod pa dang / brjod du med pa'i phyir don so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: They are the knowledge of the path that is the cause of the result, the knowledge of the result that is the result of the cause, the knowledge of conditions that is dependent origination, the knowledge of the accumulation that is the multiplicity, the knowledge of the individual investigation of meaning that is inexpressible,🔽the knowledge of the individual investigation of phenomena that is the indivisibility of the realm of phenomena, the knowledge of the individual investigation of definitions that is the nonarising of name and form, the knowledge of the individual investigation of eloquence that is the echo-like nature of sound,

original: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir chos so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod pa dang / ming dang / gzugs 'byung ba med pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod pa dang / sgra brag ca dang mtshungs pa'i phyir spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir chos so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod pa dang / ming dang / gzugs 'byung ba med pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod pa dang / sgra brag ca dang mtshungs pa'i phyir spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: and the knowledge of the individual investigation of confidence that is the absence of the mind and mental factors.

original: tshig 'bru gsal ba nyid kyis don la rton pa la spyod pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma spangs pa nyid kyis ye shes la rton pa la spyod pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa stong nyid kyis nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: tshig 'bru gsal ba nyid kyis don la rton pa la spyod pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma spangs pa nyid kyis ye shes la rton pa la spyod pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa stong nyid kyis nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice relying on the meaning by means of clear words, they practice relying on gnosis by not abandoning the domain of consciousness, they practice relying on sūtras of definitive meaning by means of the emptiness of the ripening of karma,

original: gang zag yongs su smin par bya ba nyid kyis chos la rton pa la spyod pa dang / las rnam par dag pa'i phyir lha'i mig la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i phyir lha'i rna ba la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa'i phyir pha rol gyi sems shes pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: gang zag yongs su smin par bya ba nyid kyis chos la rton pa la spyod pa dang / las rnam par dag pa'i phyir lha'i mig la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i phyir lha'i rna ba la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa'i phyir pha rol gyi sems shes pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: they practice relying on the Dharma by means of bringing beings to full maturity, they practice the divine eye by means of pure karma, they practice the divine ear by means of pure discipline, they practice the knowledge of the minds of others by means of pure samādhi,

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa la spyod pa dang / @198b sems la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul mngon par bsgrub pa la spyod pa dang / mi phyed pa'i phyir spyod pa brtan pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa la spyod pa dang / @198b sems la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul mngon par bsgrub pa la spyod pa dang / mi phyed pa'i phyir spyod pa brtan pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: “They practice the knowledge of recollecting past lives because the three times are the same; they practice the accomplishment of miracles because they have control over the mind; they practice firm conduct because it is indivisible;

original: mi lhod pa'i phyir spyod pa sra ba la spyod pa dang / bskyod du med pa'i phyir gnas med pa la spyod pa dang / tha dad pa med pa nyid kyis spyod pa mnyam pa la spyod pa dang / thams cad rjes su ma brtags pa'i phyir sa dang /
analyzed: mi lhod pa'i phyir spyod pa sra ba la spyod pa dang / bskyod du med pa'i phyir gnas med pa la spyod pa dang / tha dad pa med pa nyid kyis spyod pa mnyam pa la spyod pa dang / thams cad rjes su ma brtags pa'i phyir sa dang /
translated: they practice solid conduct because it is not loose; they practice nonabiding because it is unmoving; they practice equal conduct because it is undifferentiated; they practice conduct like earth, water, fire, wind, and space because they do not examine anything;

original: chu dang; me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' lta bur spyod pa dang / rnam par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir sgyu ma lta bu la spyod pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rmi lam lta bu la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: chu dang; me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' lta bur spyod pa dang / rnam par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir sgyu ma lta bu la spyod pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rmi lam lta bu la spyod pa dang /
translated: they practice like an illusion because of the characteristics of accomplishment; they practice like a dream because of the characteristics of unreality;

original: rnam par rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis smig rgyu lta bu la spyod pa dang / bdag mi sbed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / sems rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa dang / khams gsum rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis smig rgyu lta bu la spyod pa dang / bdag mi sbed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / sems rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa dang / khams gsum rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice mirage-like conduct with the characteristic of complete delusion. They practice emptiness with the characteristic of not hiding the self. They practice signlessness with the characteristic of the mind being essenceless. They practice wishlessness with the characteristic of the three realms being essenceless.

original: 'dus byas rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la spyod pa dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa 'jug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdud tshar bcad pa la spyod pa dang / spyod pa thams cad rnam par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la spyod pa dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa 'jug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdud tshar bcad pa la spyod pa dang / spyod pa thams cad rnam par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa la spyod pa ste /
translated: They practice the absence of formation with the characteristic of conditioned phenomena being essenceless. They practice the destruction of Māra with the characteristic of the absence of engagement of mind, thought, and consciousness. They practice the unbroken lineage of the Three Jewels with the characteristic of accomplishing all practices.

original: lha'i bu / de ltar spyod @199a *//
analyzed: lha'i bu / de ltar spyod @199a *//
translated: Son of a god, those who practice in that way

original: lha'i bus smras pa /

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu brgyad khri'ang len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //

original: srog chags dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / @216b dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma nyi khri'ang len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: srog chags dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / @216b dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma nyi khri'ang len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: twenty thousand living beings, monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen, were liberated from the defilements with nothing further to destroy.

translated: The entire assembly was delighted, joyful, and overjoyed. They were gladdened and enraptured, and they exclaimed:🔽“Ah! The Dharma, which is completely free,

analyzed: dmigs med chos ni legs par bshad //

analyzed: shin tu legs par bshad par byas //

analyzed: steng gi bar snang las kyang lha'i me tog gi char dag kyang phab /

analyzed: rin po che'i char dag kyang phab /

original: gos kyi char dag kyang phab /
analyzed: gos kyi char dag kyang phab /

analyzed: bdug spos kyi char dag dang / spos chu'i char dag dang / phye ma'i char dag kyang phab bo //

analyzed: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor rnams kyis kyang thal mo sbyar te tshig 'di skad ces /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ngan song dang / ngan 'gro'i sgo bkum pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la shin tu gus pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bgyis pa gzo zhing bgyis pa tshor ba lags shing /
translated: They have closed the door to the lower realms and the lower migrations. They are sustained by spiritual teachers. They have great respect for spiritual teachers. They are grateful to spiritual teachers and recognize what they have done.

translated: Maitreya, when this Dharma discourse was explained, among the multitudes of gods and humans, twenty-two thousand beings attained the stainless and immaculate Dharma eye regarding all phenomena.

analyzed: lha dang / mi rnams kyi skye dgu las srog chags 'bum phrag brgyad ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: Among the multitudes of gods and humans, eight hundred thousand beings attained liberation of mind free from grasping regarding all phenomena.

analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma sa ya phrag gnyis kyis ni byang chub tu sems bskyed do //

translated: Five hundred thousand bodhisattvas who were present here and had gathered from other world systems attained the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa tha dad pa gnyis stong tsam gyis ni gzungs na tshogs so sor thob par gyur to //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'bum gyis ni gzungs dri ma med pa so sor thob par gyur to //
translated: One hundred thousand bodhisattvas attained the individual stainless dhāraṇī.

original: de dag las byang chub sems dpa' mang po dag /
analyzed: de dag las byang chub sems dpa' mang po dag /
translated: Among them, many bodhisattvas

original: @218b byang chub sems dpa' byams pa /
analyzed: @218b byang chub sems dpa' byams pa /
translated: the bodhisattva Maitreya,

translated: You will uphold the sublime Dharma of those who have attained enlightenment, and you will receive, teach, uphold, and read profound sūtras such as this.

analyzed: de dag ni byams pa khyod nyid kyis byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Maitreya, you will prophesy their enlightenment.”

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Maitreya said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽if sons or daughters of noble family uphold this sūtra,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag mdo sde 'di 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba dang / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bgyi ba'i slad du glegs bam du bgyis te 'chang ba dang / tha na lan 'ga' zhig nyan par bgyid pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag mdo sde 'di 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba dang / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bgyi ba'i slad du glegs bam du bgyis te 'chang ba dang / tha na lan 'ga' zhig nyan par bgyid pa dang /
translated: read it, teach it, write it down, keep it in the form of a book in order to preserve the sublime Dharma for a long time, listen to it at least once,

analyzed: rna lam du grags par bgyid pa de dag bsod nams ji tsam bskyed par 'gyur lags /

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva Maitreya:
