analyzed: byams pa / khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di yongs su 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
translated: “Maitreya, it is excellent that you have thought to ask the Thus-Gone One about this matter.

original: legs so // byams pa /
analyzed: legs so // byams pa /
translated: Excellent, Maitreya!

original: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, listen well and keep this in mind. I will explain it to you.

original: byams pa / nan gyis dper na /🔽lha dang / mi rnams kyi skye dgu las lha'am /🔽mi gang zhig gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'khor gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma @219a *//
analyzed: byams pa / nan gyis dper na / lha dang / mi rnams kyi skye dgu las lha'am / mi gang zhig gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'khor gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma @219a *//
translated: Maitreya, to give an analogy,🔽suppose that a god or human being were to serve with all the necessities of happiness as many blessed buddhas, together with retinues as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River, for eons as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: snyed dang bcas pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig la bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa de bas ni gang gis mdo sde legs par gsungs pa 'di yi ger bris te 'dzin
analyzed: snyed dang bcas pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig la bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa de bas ni gang gis mdo sde legs par gsungs pa 'di yi ger bris te 'dzin
translated: Compared to that, someone who writes out and upholds this well-spoken discourse will generate far more merit.

original: pa dang / klog pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed pa dang / gzhan dag la ston par byed pa ches bsod nams mang du bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa dang / klog pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed pa dang / gzhan dag la ston par byed pa ches bsod nams mang du bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and to teach it to others, they will generate a great deal of merit.

original: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ring por mi thogs par byang chub kyi snying por nye bar 'gro bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ring por mi thogs par byang chub kyi snying por nye bar 'gro bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will quickly approach the site of awakening in order to fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: byams pa / nga ni gang dag gis mdo sde 'di thos nas spong bar mi byed cing mos par byed pa dang / tha na glegs bam du 'dri bar byed pa de dag kyang mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa nyid du lung ston to //
analyzed: byams pa / nga ni gang dag gis mdo sde 'di thos nas spong bar mi byed cing mos par byed pa dang / tha na glegs bam du 'dri bar byed pa de dag kyang mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa nyid du lung ston to //
translated: Maitreya, I prophesy that those who hear this discourse and do not reject it, but instead feel inspired and even write it down, will be irreversible from awakening in accordance with their aspirations.

original: byams pa / nga ni gang dag gi mdo sde zab mo 'di lta bu 'di ni ming tsam thos pa de dag kyang 'bras bu yod par lung ston par byed na gang dag mos pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang /
analyzed: byams pa / nga ni gang dag gi mdo sde zab mo 'di lta bu 'di ni ming tsam thos pa de dag kyang 'bras bu yod par lung ston par byed na gang dag mos pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang /
translated: Maitreya, I prophesy that those who hear the mere name of this profound discourse will have a fruitful result, let alone those who feel inspired, write it down, read it,

original: gzhan dag la'ang ston par byed pa dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gzhan dag la'ang ston par byed pa dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to speak of those who teach it to others?

original: gang dag mdo sde 'di yi ger 'dri ba dang / lung nod pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / klog pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed pa de dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang lhan cig tu gtam 'dri @219b bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: gang dag mdo sde 'di yi ger 'dri ba dang / lung nod pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / klog pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed pa de dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang lhan cig tu gtam 'dri @219b bar byed pa dang /
translated: Those who write out this sūtra, recite it, chant it, read it, and practice it in accordance with the teaching will converse with the blessed buddhas.

original: phebs par smra bar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phebs par smra bar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: They will speak with them in a friendly way.

original: de dag ni rtag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis kyang de dag la ston par mdzad cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rtag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis kyang de dag la ston par mdzad cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never be separated from the blessed buddhas, and the blessed buddhas who dwell in other world systems, and the bodhisattva great beings, will teach them and prophesy their unsurpassed, perfect awakening.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos pa de ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'dra ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos pa de ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'dra ba yin gyi /
translated: to hear this Dharma discourse is like encountering a buddha.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: khyod kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di zungs shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di zungs shig /
translated: you should uphold this Dharma discourse.

original: gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher ston cig /
analyzed: gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher ston cig /
translated: You should teach it extensively to others.

original: kun dga' bos gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: kun dga' bos gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Ānanda said, “Blessed One,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci zhes bgyi /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci zhes bgyi /
translated: what is the name of this Dharma discourse?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
translated: How should it be upheld?

original: 'di'i ming ji skad bstan par bgyi lags /
analyzed: 'di'i ming ji skad bstan par bgyi lags /
translated: What should its teaching be called?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lha'i bu rab rtsal sems kyis zhus pa zhes bya ba dang / 'jam dpal gyis bstan pa chos thams cad rnam par gtan la dbab pa bstan pa zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lha'i bu rab rtsal sems kyis zhus pa zhes bya ba dang / 'jam dpal gyis bstan pa chos thams cad rnam par gtan la dbab pa bstan pa zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
translated: you should uphold this Dharma discourse as ‘The Questions of the Devaputra Su­vikrānta­vikrāmiṇ,’ and also as ‘The Teaching of Mañjuśrī: The Teaching on Ascertaining All Dharmas.’

original: de nas 'khor de dag gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming thos nas thal mo sbyar te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol @220a *//
analyzed: de nas 'khor de dag gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming thos nas thal mo sbyar te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol @220a *//
translated: Then, having heard the name of this Dharma discourse, the assembly joined their palms and said to the Blessed One,

original: to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdag cag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas chos bstan pa mang du thos lags na ji ltar chos kyi rnam grangs rab tu rnam par phye ste rgya cher bstan pa de lta bu'i chos ni nam yang ma byung lags so //
analyzed: bdag cag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas chos bstan pa mang du thos lags na ji ltar chos kyi rnam grangs rab tu rnam par phye ste rgya cher bstan pa de lta bu'i chos ni nam yang ma byung lags so //
translated: we have heard many Dharma teachings given by Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, but we have never heard a Dharma teaching as extensively and clearly explained as this one.

original: bdag cag gis kyang chos kyi rnam grangs la dga' ba 'di lta bu thob pa ni sngon ma myong lags te /
analyzed: bdag cag gis kyang chos kyi rnam grangs la dga' ba 'di lta bu thob pa ni sngon ma myong lags te /
translated: We have never before experienced such joy in a Dharma discourse.

original: de lta lags pas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang skye bo mang po la sman pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams kyi slad du chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ci nas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bgyid par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de lta lags pas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang skye bo mang po la sman pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams kyi slad du chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ci nas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bgyid par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, after the Blessed One’s parinirvāṇa, for the benefit of many beings and for the sake of future generations, may this Dharma discourse be practiced as the Buddha’s activity.

original: sems can mos pa tha dad pa rnams kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos nas mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa tha dad pas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / de dag bde 'gror mchi bar bgyi bar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di legs par byin gyis brlab tu gsol de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor bzhi po de dag gis gsol ba btab par thugs su chud nas phyogs bcur rnam par gzigs so //
analyzed: sems can mos pa tha dad pa rnams kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos nas mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa tha dad pas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / de dag bde 'gror mchi bar bgyi bar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di legs par byin gyis brlab tu gsol de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor bzhi po de dag gis gsol ba btab par thugs su chud nas phyogs bcur rnam par gzigs so //
translated: May the Blessed One bless this Dharma discourse so that sentient beings with different aspirations, having heard it, will attain liberation through the different vehicles in accordance with their aspirations, and may they go to the higher realms.”🔽Then the Blessed One, understanding the request of the fourfold assembly, looked in the ten directions.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyogs bcur rnam par gzigs ma thag tu de nas de'i mod la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i sa gzhi chen po rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos par gyur cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyogs bcur rnam par gzigs ma thag tu de nas de'i mod la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i sa gzhi chen po rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos par gyur cing /
translated: As soon as the Blessed One looked in the ten directions, immediately the great earth of this billion-world-galactic universe shook in six ways,

original: lha @220b dang; klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyang dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yi rangs pa dang / spro ba dang /
analyzed: lha @220b dang; klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyang dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yi rangs pa dang / spro ba dang /
translated: The gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas were also delighted, pleased, and overjoyed.

original: dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas ci nas kyang phyi ma'i dus na chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nub bar mi 'gyur bar byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems can la dga' ba rnams dang /🔽nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la lha'i mchod pa dag byas shing sted gi bar snang las me tog gi char dag kyang rab tu phab /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas ci nas kyang phyi ma'i dus na chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nub bar mi 'gyur bar byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems can la dga' ba rnams dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la lha'i mchod pa dag byas shing sted gi bar snang las me tog gi char dag kyang rab tu phab /
translated: In order to bless this Dharma discourse so that it would not disappear in the future, they made divine offerings to the Thus-Gone One, the bodhisattvas who delight in beings,🔽and the saṅgha of hearers. They caused a rain of flowers to fall from the sky above,

original: lha'i sil snyan dang / glu dbyangs dag kyang rab tu gsil cing blangs so //
analyzed: lha'i sil snyan dang / glu dbyangs dag kyang rab tu gsil cing blangs so //
translated: and they played and sang divine music.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de la 'di skad ces /
translated: Then the Tathagata made it known to the entire assembly:

original: nga dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di byin gyis brlabs so zhes go bar mdzad do //
analyzed: nga dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di byin gyis brlabs so zhes go bar mdzad do //
translated: I and the youthful Manjushri have blessed this Dharma discourse.🔽 Then the entire assembly and those bodhisattvas,

original: de nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yi rangs ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas bcom ldan 'das dang /
analyzed: de nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / yi rangs ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas bcom ldan 'das dang /
translated: having rejoiced, been delighted, been gladdened, and been overjoyed,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la mchod pa byas te /
translated: made offerings to the Blessed One and to the youthful Manjushri.

original: rang rang gi gnas su dong ngo //
analyzed: rang rang gi gnas su dong ngo //
translated: Then they went to their own abodes.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken thus,

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo @221a *//🔽dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de yi rangs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo @221a *// dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de yi rangs te /
translated: the bodhisattva Maitreya, the venerable Ananda,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: and the entire assembly rejoiced and praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: 'phags pa lha'i bu rab rtsal sems kyis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa lha'i bu rab rtsal sems kyis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble Great Vehicle sūtra called “The Questions of the Noble Son Suvikrāntavikrāmin” is completed.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po pradzny'a warma dang / zhus chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan phab pa //
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po pradzny'a warma dang / zhus chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan phab pa //
translated: Translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian preceptor Prajñāvarman and the chief editor and translator Bandé Yeshé Dé and others.
